title: Fabulous hotel in a great location!
text: This was our first time staying at the Concord hotel located in Upper Midtown (East side) of New York City. It is in a safe area & our room was quiet. (We had a room on the 27th floor which is why it may have been so quiet.) The hotel is close to Central Park and Rockefeller Center & a short walk to Grand Central terminal. Our room was clean, comfortable, very spacious, & had lots of natural light from the windows. Our bathroom had a large soaking tub, separate from the walk in shower. Our room had several charging outlets (which is a big bonus in my eyes). We dined at the Bonsall Tapa bar located on the ground level & we loved it; Excellent tapas, great drinks & lovely staff. Our reception & bell hop were kind, courteous & helpful (especially with recommendations & directions).  I highly recommend this hotel for the location, the helpful staff & the comfortable room.

title: A Delightful Midtown Gem with Amazing Staff
text:
There really aren’t enough nice things to say about this extraordinary hotel! Not only is the location ideal— centrally located near several restaurants, shops, sites of interest, and even a short stroll to Central Park, but also 2 blocks from an (E,M) subway station and 5 short blocks away from an (N,R,W) subway station. This makes getting to the hotel from LGA super simple with a total 35 minute trip on the currently free Q70-SBS LaGuardia Link +Select bus to Roosevelt Av/74 St and then the E subway from Jackson Hts - Roosevelt Av directly to two blocks from the hotel. Don’t miss out on this tip, as it’s a lot easier than you’d think and infinitely cheaper at just under $3 vs anything else you’d do. Entering the hotel is a full sensory experience! You leave the bustling NYC streets and are immediately enveloped into a haven of inspiring music and alluring aromas. The lobby area is cozy and clean, but opens to a spacious and convenient check-in/check-out counter, which is situated immediately across from the elevators. This layout and the super efficient check-in process makes it truly uncomplicated to get in from your journey to the hotel and be in your room in a matter of moments. The elevator requires key cards to access your appropriate floor, which adds to the effect of safety and security. While there are 37 floors in this hotel, the elevators are modern and fast, so it never took too long going up or down. The beauty of the layout or the floors is that there are only 4 suites per floor! It’s so divine to not be disturbed with lots of people running up and down the hallways while you’re enjoying the truly BEAUTIFUL rooms. There are so many options to choose from, but I spent my time in a 28th floor Premier King, which was 325 sq. ft or 30 sq. m of well appointed goodness! I had some critical criteria in my hotel selection for this particular visit and they nailed them all: King Bed (which is not easy for boutique or chain hotels to pull off in real estate challenged Manhattan); a desk for some work; solid free wifi; a large modern TV; huge windows with a spectacular view; couch (leather cushioned window bench in this case) seating; a mini refrigerator; Nespresso; air conditioning, noiseless walls/ceiling and a separate bathtub and shower! The ambiance in the room was stylish and comfortable— you’d easily feel like not leaving, which was the goal! However, when I did journey out for daily adventures, I was truly grateful for the convenient location and ease of transportation— subway, Uber, and walking. On the 4th floor, there was a well appointed business center and a solid gym with cardio and weight machines, free weight dumbbells, towels, water, AND a full bathroom with shower! While I didn’t use it, there was a cute restaurant right off the lobby. Truly you couldn’t ask for anything more or better, but they gave you more anyway! I saved the best for last. The primary reason this will be my GO TO NYC hotel from now on is the incredible staff! Seriously MAJOR kudos to the friendly and helpful staff that were on hand ALL THE TIME to help in any way possible. And they all genuinely cared about the guests. From the second I checked in to every time I walked in/out of the hotel, they remembered me and would take time to chat and see how I was enjoying my stay. When I left, it felt like I was saying goodbye to old friends! So, thank you tremendously Sandy, Kiara, Ivana, and Samuel— this hotel is ONLY as good as you are, and you are awesome!
Do yourself a favor— do not pass on this hotel, but do save room for my visits!

title: Great location with lovely staff!
text: My family and I were really impressed during our stay at the Concorde. The room and bathroom were both spacious and spotless and the location was fab. Our trip took an unfortunate turn with some of the family having to stay in New York longer than intended, and the hotel staff were all super understanding, helpful, kind and accommodating throughout the whole situation. We will be recommending this hotel to our friends and family!

title: Comfortable in New York City
text: Lexington and 55 E is a very convenient location, with good hotel service and an excellent tapas bar. However, the internet could be improved. Streaming was OK, but the phone connection and WhatsApp for international calls gave me some problems. Clean and quiet. A place to keep in mind.

title: St Patricks Day
text:
Excellent hotel and perfect location. Fantastic bathroom and will rebook on my next stay in New York. Very professional and extremely courteous staff. Delightful.

Restaurant was also superb and could not fault a thing.

title: Great place
text:
Excellent service especially from the restaurant staff and Syed. 
Great hotel location;  Very good cleanliness and amenities. It is the second time I have stayed at Concorde, highly recommended. On this occasion my trip was for business and pleasure; the hotel worked perfect for me

title: Concorde Hotel Stay
text: My wife and I had a short trip[ to New York and this was our first stay at this hotel.  The room was very nice.  Modern, clean, and spacious.  At night it was quiet as it faced the back of the hotel.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Fantastic hotel and great location
text: At the reception, we were greeted by Ajla, who was very kind and helpful. She recommended several places for us to visit that were outside of our original plans and we definitely would have missed out on a unique experience if it weren't for her. I must say she gave the impression that she is very proud of this hotel and I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone. It was nice and clean. The hotel is in an excellent location.

title: Hidden Gem!
text: Love this hotel - it’s my new spot!  I travel a fair amount to NYC for work and came across this boutique property based on its locations, price and reviews.  You can’t beat it.  VERY pleasant check in experience with Sandy, at reception, and was put in a nice room on the 35th floor.  The lobby is great, the staff was all exceptionally professional and friendly.  The little bar / restaurant was perfect.  I will be back, sooner than later!

title: Hotel and Dining
text:
very nice! Bonsaii was very yummy for a nice brunch, Gio was an amazing waiter! Sandy was very sweet and welcoming.
There is a heated area outside for eating. The mimosas and food were very good. Location is very convenient for local transportation.

title: Great
text:
I liked everything and everyone 
Front desk is great 
Room service is very good
Location is good 
Welcoming people 
Helpful stuff
Clean rooms

I think I will come again 
Thanks to Ajla, Estefania, Sandy, kiara,Syed, Andre bellman and Abdulmajid

title: Great location
text: Great location! Lovely hotel, exceptionally comfortable beds and pillows, Good size bathrooms with a bath and a shower.  the only fault is the lifts are a bit slow and the rooms not massive but probably a good size for a mid range hotel in New York. Staff very pleasant. Highly recommend.

title: Helpful and friendly staff
text: . Staff is very friendly and helpful. Sandy met us and remembered us from our last visit. Handled our car and our luggage and all our questions with professionalism and helpfulness.  Will be staying again. Thank you to the staff, and especially Sandy.

title: Great place to stay in New York
text: It is a great place to stay. Location is good not far from central Park and with great subway connections close by. The place is very clean and tidy. Rooms are a great size for New York and the pricing is very sensible. We would go back there is we were back in New York. The restaurant does great breakfasts and serves lovely tapas in the evening.

title: Friendly staff and very clean room!
text:
Lovely stay! Roomservice was excellent, and all staff members were friendly and welcoming. Sandy and Chanelle at the front desk answered all of my questions and were more than accommodative.

Thanks for the great experience! I'll definitely be back!

title: A very good balance
text:
Well situated, clean, relatively large rooms for its category, friendly staff… this hotel has many qualities and I put it in the chapters of my favourites in Manhattan, in the category of “non-luxury but good” hotels.
It is quiet, except in case of strong wind as some external parts of the building become quite noisy.
Breakfast is quite poor (like in most of peers hotels in NYC) and I would advise to take it outside.

title: Beautiful comfort
text: Service was friendly and excellent, Sandy at the front desk was very hospitable. Stayed on the 37th floor, the view was spectacular. Strong wifi and the hotel was excellent located. Appreciated the coffee on the 3rd floor while waiting for our car.

title: CHRISTMAS IN NEW YORK..WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE
text: Highly recommended hotel... within walking distance of many NY attractions, close to the subway entrances. Super friendly and efficient staff, very quick and friendly. modern rooms although small note for a family of 4 people there is little furniture to keep clothes in my opinion (1 week 4 people winter - clothing is bulky) - floor 3 is very useful for storing water, I use a PC and very well thought out coffee! the restaurant in the hotel is truly a gem!...SUPER RECOMMENDED HOTEL FOR NY!!

title: City view room with loads of windows
text: Great room on a high floor with huge windows for a great city view. Free coffee on level 3 and in our room. The room had a recycling bin which I’m impressed with. The staff were great. We had a free wine in the bar which was lovely. They didn’t do anything special for our honeymoon even though they knew which was a shame. It wasn’t cheap

title: Perfect service
text: Francisco was great when I was checking into the property. Helpful, kind, and very nice. The room was amazing and stunning. Location was convenient and the restaurant on site Bonsaii was amazing . They gave us two glasses of wine at the time we checked into the property

title: Restful location in New York
text: Lovely hotel, located in a quieter area on East Midtown but very easy to get to all the sights. Got the subway from JFK without any problems. We used this as a base to get to the theatre, Summit One and walking around 5th Avenue and Central Park. Staff were very helpful, providing local tips.

title: Nice size room with good views
text: Great hotel in a great midtown location. Nice size room and bathroom. We were on the 36th floor and had a great view. The hotel has only four rooms on most floors and often, if you are on a high floor, you stop a lot on the way down in the elevator. This means that everyone kind of says hello and interacts. That was kind of fun. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The only glitch for us was that the hot water was sometimes elusive, but always arrived eventually. Would recommend and stay there again.

title: Amazing service - great location
text: Great hotel, fantastic location. The hotel staff is super friendly, specially SYED who was always helpful and with a welcoming smile that exceeded expectations, giving his very best to all guests. I definitely recommend staying at the Concorde when visiting NY,

title: Decent hotel and central location mid town east.
text: Rooms are relatively large for New York standards and hence rather comfortable. Bathrooms are also (very) large. The rooms are, however, a little dates and would benefit from some refurbishment. Overall recommended and centrally located. Unfortunately, no room service.

title: The best hotel in Manhattan
text: A unique boutique hotel. A new, clean, breathing hotel. At the center of everything. Large rooms, very comfortable beds. Super professional, kind staff, you are welcome any time you walk in and wish a wonderful day when you leave. Kiara our Angel made everything easy and smooth. At the 3rd floor….paradise: cappuccino, coffee, chocolate, tea etc.  A great experience ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Beautiful hotel with a great location
text:
The hotel is nicely decorated, the location of the hotel is perfect.  Reason why we chose this hotel is because they don't have hidden additional taxes to pay, like most other hotels. Hotel rooms are very clean and if you are lucky you can get a room with an incredible view of the city.
The hotel staff are incredibly kind, mrs. Ajla and mrs. Kiara, they really went out of their way to give us all the information we needed. Doorman (we doesn’t know his name) he was so kind and took our lagguage and help to us when we get to the hotel.
We definitely recommend this hotel and we will definitely come back again

title: It was alright, the view of the room was good, no housekeeping. Over all average to above average experience.
text: Would like to give a big thumbs up to Syed from the bell desk and concierge. He’s very welcoming and warm and goes the extra mile to show warmth. I would also like to appreciate youn (pronounced  like the number “one”) from the bonsai cafe for displaying exceptional warmth not seen in most American hotels.

title: Excellent
text: the hotel is excellent. excellent service. the girls Ajla and Sandy work at the reception  are very friendly. The rooms are very spacious and very clean. the view is excellent. Food also is great. 🤩🥰

title: Great clean room
text: We stayed only one night. The room was very clean and bright and had enough space. The bathroom was also very clean and bright with both a bathtub and shower. Check in was quick as efficient. Bellman Syed was very helpful and kind with bag storage and getting a cab at the specified time for airport transfer. Would stay again

title: Syed is the Best!
text: Syed is the reason to stay at the Concorde! His attention to detail and level of service is unmatched. Any guest who has the opportunity to interact with him would be lucky! Thanks for a great stay, Concorde!

title: Top Notch Hotel Staff - Francisco is the best!!
text: The hotel is fantastic and the rooms are so spacious for a New York hotel. However, the best part of my stay was the hotel staff. Every interaction I had with them was fantastic. I was greeted by Francisco who made me feel right at home. I lost my wallet on the last night of my stay. I was telling Francisco about the mishap when I was checking out. He asked me where I had been the night before and then proceeded to call those locations to ask if they had found it! Truly top notch service! (I got my wallet back, by the way — thank you Francisco!!!)

title: a great place to stay in midtown manhatten
text: this hotel was excellent. wonderful staff. very helpful with my questions. the bellperson Syed was amazing and assisted me with transport to the airport so that I had no concerns during my stay. the hotel was very convenient to where I needed to go and there were many options close by for food.

title: A Cosy Hotel With A Big Heart.
text: After spending weeks (off and on) trying to choose the right hotel, me and my husband John finally made our decision. I had a lot of anxiety before arriving in Manhattan as to whether the Concorde hotel room would live up to my expectations. It was my 60th birthday so things had to be 'just right'! I analysed the size of the rooms online in advance and the bathrooms, paying particular attention to the bed size and whether a great view would/ could  be included. We were given a warm welcome and showed to our room. My initial reaction was disappointment, the room felt quite small and the view was awful (overlooking a low building with an ugly roof) There was no lounge area as such, and I just felt 'oh gosh is this it'! I went downstairs and asked whether we could change rooms, unfortunately there was nothing available that first night. In the morning I went down to reception feeling pretty emotional (tears in my eyes to be honest) and was hoping for some great customer service and a much needed  alternative room. From the moment I met 'Sandy' on reception i just knew that she could sense my dissapointment and would do anything in her power to make things right. She organised another room for us which was much more what we had in mind, and the view was SO much better! Her professionalism, warmth and understanding was second to none. I will never forget her kindness. Needless to say we settled in so well and our trip was an absolute dream. I would like to go into some more detail about the bed and the bathroom so that fussy people like me can take reassurance from an experienced  traveler like myself. The bed was super large and I can honestly say that it was the most comfortable hotel bed I can ever remember sleeping in, the bedding was so soft and luxurious, the pillows 'just right'. The housekeepers did a great job of making the bed so well every day. The bathroom was EXCELLENT, so spacious with great lighting, a large well lit magnifying mirror by the sink. The shower was great with a handy ledge  for products, a bath was in there too, it was all done to a  high end finish and we had plenty of great quality fluffy white towels. To me the bed and the bathroom is so important. The fridge wasn't great but nevertheless we had one, and the coffee machine was clean and easy to use. Al l the staff were friendly and  obviously passionate about customer service, in particular Francisco and Andre who would go above and beyond to offer support. We will definitely return to the Concorde and will recommend to family and friends.

title: Excelente experiencia.
text:
La atención fue extraordinaria desde el primer minuto, con Francisco y Estefanía en la recepción y Andrés que nos recibía cada día al llegar, luego de unas largas caminatas.
La habitación estaba muy bien equipada, preciosas vistas y el servicio de habitación también excelente.

title: Manhattan Touchdown
text: Great hotel and great service. We had a very clean and comfortable room with a fantastic view of the synagogue. The staff were all very helpful especially Syed who sorted out our lifts and luggage. Would recommend as a great central place to stay.

title: Awesome well appointed hotel
text: This is a beautiful classy hotel with good services- including a nice tapas restaurant and excellent coffee. The interior decorations and location couldn't be better. The front desk staff are super helpful and kind. Syed was a wonderful help calling us a car. Excellent vibe ane service all around!

title: No. One to stay moving forward!
text:
This is not less than 5/5👍.  The all staff of Concorde are amazing friendly and very very efficient.  They serve with love.  All are amazing from check in to Check out.  Mr. Syed was a great welcome for us and every time he serviced us  with love and passion. He also answer our questions about great places and restaurants to visit. Francisco and many other staff were just outstanding.  The hotel location is excellent were you can go to top attractions within a 10-20 min walking.  Very quite not noisy and easy in and out you can have a good sleep without any distribution or construction works :).  The rooms were best I tried in NY very clean and decently furnished and wide enough. 

Certainly, I will be a frequent visitor to this great and fairly priced hotel and outstanding staff.  

Yezed

title: Great stay at Concorde
text: Excellent stay at this wonderful centrally located hotel with an extremely attentive staff including sandy.   We loved the size of the hotel which made it feel quite like a home away from home. We’d come again for sure.

title: One of the nicest hotels I've been to !!
text: wonderful experience... right from the moment of arrival. The welcome and courtesy were the strong points of this hotel... the rooms are spacious as you can't find in NY with all the necessary comforts and more... the location is excellent, away from the center but accessible to everyone...a special thanks to SHENEL at the reception (very kind and ready to satisfy any request) and to all the rest of the staff. thanks also to SYED, who was able to give us all the information about the city (local shopping and transfers). I recommend the Concorde hotel to anyone who wants to take a holiday in NY! Thanks again .

title: A great experience for a family vacation !
text: I stayed at this hotel with my parents and we had an amazing experience . The staff was very friendly, accommodating and catered to all our needs .. The rooms were clean and we got all the amenities we were expecting . Shout out to Sandy for taking great care of us and giving us an early check in and being extremely helpful with all the queries. The hotel is at a convenient location and subway stations and places to eat are easily accessible . I would definitely recommend this hotel !

title: Good Location and friendly staff
text: I stayed for 6 nights. The hotel is very well located and the room was spacious and clean. Francisco made my checkin and check-out experience very smooth and went out of his way to ensure I have a comfortable stay be it with laundry, food recommendation or car booking. Kindly note my company paid for my visit so I cannot comment on the price.

title: Weekend trip
text: Very lovely hotel staff, my husband and I especially loved the help we got from Syed from concierge! The rooms were also spacious and very clean. We will definitely come back to this hotel. They also offer complimentary coffee which was great.

title: A beautiful stay in the heart of New York
text: Very central location in the heart of Manhattan, not very far from the main train stations. Comfort hotel, very new or renewed. Clean large room and clean common areas. Everyday cleaning. Comfortable bed.  Beautiful view on the city. A little café/dining availability next to the Lobby. Very kind reception staff.  Particularly André Bellman, who was on reception duty, was also very efficient on our requests

title: Excellent hotel !
text:
Très bel hôtel au coeur de midtown : les chambres sont claires, bien décorées, avec une superbe vue et une propreté impeccable. 
Un petit frigo dans la chambre avec un micro ondes en libre service au 3è étage, c'est parfait quand on veut diner tranquillement sans sortir. 
Tout le personnel est charmant, très attentif, en particulier Sandy à la réception et Abdul le doorman. 
Il manque peut etre un rooftop  (il y a bien une terrasse, mais elle est connectée à une chambre en particulier).

title: Great door man and service!
text:
Nice clean hotel. 
Syed the doorman is amazing! Went out of his way to help me out! The hotel is clean and conveniently located. Would recommend this hotel for business or fun! Free coffee and water vending on the third floor

title: adresse impeccable  dont position géographique est tres bonne
text:
Très bon rapport qualité prix
Emplacement géographique idéal ( pour nous…) 
Décoration moderne sobre. Nickel. Espaces optimisés : ce n est pas un hôtel mammouth ! Du coup on s y sent bien 
Personnel sympathique et avenant 
Bons cocktails à déguster au bar …
PS: seul petit inconvénient les portes d accès chambres n ont pas une protection acoustique suffisante ( on entend les passages et mouvements autour ascenseurs ). Mais ce n est pas si gênant

title: Good hotel Manhattan New York
text:
Very good hotel, with excellent service.
Clean and big rooms most of them with a nice view.
Gym was brand new and really nice car with good enough equipment.
Would recommend both for tourism and for business. ( Business facility at the hotel has everything you need)
Special thanks to Sandy and Jeannie 👍

title: Great Hotel!!
text:
Great hotel
Amazing location, walking distance from fifth avenue 
Amazing staff, super friendly and accommodating 
Have to give huge credit tinSandy who always takes care of us, two years in a row and makes us feel home

This was our second time here and the level remained the same, highly recommend it

title: Nice, quiet stay at a good price
text:
We had a very quiet, luxurious stay! The room was very comfortable with a beautiful view. I was happy that the layout of the hotel meant that there were just a few rooms per floor, as we hardly heard anyone around us at all. The rain shower was really nice, but as others say it definitely spills out onto the floor if you aren't careful.
Customer service was top notch, including Syed, who held our bags on our last day until time for our flight and helped us get a quick ride to the airport.

title: Calm Quite and Neat But Not Worth The Price
text: The Concorde Hotel in New York is truly exquisite. It boasts spacious rooms, especially by New York standards, and maintains impeccable cleanliness. The staff are exceptionally courteous and accommodating. Additionally, the hotel features a sophisticated establishment on the ground floor, Bonsaii Tapas & Wine Bar, which is both stylish and inviting. However, considering the absence of an on-site lounge and swimming pool, I found the rates rather too expensive. On my first night, I was charged almost $900 for a standard room for one night. It's possible that my visit during the United Nations General Assembly influenced the pricing. Nonetheless, I would recommend a reconsideration of their pricing structure.

title: Very nice hotel close to city center
text:
Very nice location, close to the city center yet not too crowded. Room was very nice and tidy also. I liked how the hotel had a free for all coffee machine and a 24 hour fitness center

SYED is one of the best hotel staff members i've ever encountered. Very genuine!

title: Great hotel, will repeat our stay there
text:
This was really great experience, hotel is in great position on 25 minutes walking distance from major attractions (Empire State Building, Chrysler Tower, Times Square, Central Park...). It is perfectly clean, rooms are very spacious (especially for New York), view from the room is wonderful. The beds are very comfortable and you have all necessary amenities in the hotel and in the room. You got free Nespresso coffee every day. 
The staff is probably the best part- they are very kind and polite, giving all the necessary information and everything you need you get almost immediately. The girls on the reception Ajla and Sandy were very helpful. My wife and I will definitely repeat our stay in this place.

title: An Amazing Birthday Celebration at Concorde Hotel!
text: What a fantastic stay! We celebrated my wife's birthday here and couldn't be happier. The room was sleek and clean, and the view of the city was nice. Special shoutout to Sandy at the front desk. She was super nice and even recommended some great nearby spots to check out. Service was top-notch. I can't wait to come back for another special occasion. Thanks, Concorde Hotel!

title: Clean, Friendly, Enjoyable, Fun.                       Thank you
text: The rooms are clean and the staff is amazing and so helpful.  Especially Sandy & Jeanne - they went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable and truly enjoyable.  I will definitely be back.  Also, so many great restaurants and coffee shops nearby.

title: Another Amazing Stay
text: This was my second stay at The Concorde and this hotel is consistently excellent. Check in and check out were a breeze thanks to the warm and helpful staff including Sandy (apologies to the others and I didn’t remember everyone’s name). Most importantly though for me is that the hotel is meticulously clean and impeccably run. I would add photos but as many reviews complain that the photos don’t accurately represent the look and quality of the property, the photos of The Concorde are EXACTLY as shown. My room was very spacious, very clean, very comfortable, and they even prepared my room with hypoallergenic bedding as feathers are not my friends. In any event, this hotel is fantastic and I plan on returning very soon. Oh and I can’t forget Sayed (sp?) who always greeted me when I arrived and wished me a great day when I would leave. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Excellent experience
text: I wanted to write this review, first of all the staff are friendly and helpful, especially Dawa in housekeeping. Bonsai cafe does cafe breakfast and tapas for dinner, also very friendly staff. They have a new gym which I tried which was descent. My room is a deluxe room, so by New York standards is large and the bathroom has bath and large shower. Nicely decorated with wood tones throughout. 12 minute walk from central park. It doesn't have room service but I can live with that.

title: MUST STAY LUXURY HOTEL! 10/10
text:
Amazing service!!! I absolutely loved my stay at the Concorde. 

It is a cozy hotel in midtown east with luxury touches throughout the hotel. The manager checked in consistently throughout our stay and accommodated every request (extra blankets, late checkout and extending the visit). Syed was also wonderful (consistently greeted us with a smile and helped us with our heavy luggage)! 

My only con is that there is no room service. However, Bonsaii cafe is located in the lobby of the building and serves wonderful tapas and wine. The hostess was super friendly and helpful. 10/10 would recommend!

title: Big Apple
text:
The hotel has a great location, and the staff is really nice and helpful!
Mainly SANDY and ABDUL!
Thank you for everything 
The rooms are also nice, and we loved Molton Brown products in the bathroom

We will return surely if we are in NYC again..

title: Sayed
text:
Sayed ist der beste Portier ! 
Sonst eher maues Personal...
Zimmer sind winzig. Aber, na gut ,  sauber. Zimmerservice auch janz jut.Keine Chill-Area. Mist. 
Jedenfalls ist Sayed der allerbeste Portier in der East-Side. Mit Abstand.  Paar kleine Ratten in den Blumentöpfen vor dem Hotel.Aber ganz niedlich.Fast zutraulich. Das Glas Tempranillo für $ 18 [0.2] kann ich empfehlen. Fenster kann man nicht öffnen, wär auch blød ob der Lautstärke draußen. Mind. 92 dBel [ startende B 767] . Sayed hat sich wohl daran gewöhnt. Gemischtes Publikum aus Japan ,Korea, Nord-Korea, Kleine Antillen, Swasiland und Comoren.Man trifft sie aber nur seltends. So im Fahrstuhl mal. Das war's dann schon. Das Turkey/Chutney Sandwich im Prêt-à-Manger eine Strasse weiter ist grauenhaft englisch und erinnert entfernt an die Zeit in Glastonbury. Ein Kopfschütteln Sayeds bestätigt meine kleine Erfahrung. Wer gerne raucht,kann sich auf dem Trottoir neben Sayed , der während leisen Gesprächen die Tür maltraitiert, ganz wohl fühlen. Wer Parisienne Zigaretten sucht, ist erst mal aufgeschmissen. Da kann selbst Sayed auch nichts sinnstifendes unternehmen, auch wenn sein Blick hilfesuchend die 55ste herunterschweift.'Greif auf Marlboro Light zurück' will er mit einem schiefen Augenaufschlag sagen , tut's aber dann doch nicht.

title: Excellent Accommodations
text: We stayed in NYC for a short weekend and needed a space that was close to Central Park. From check in to check out, the staff at The Concorde were very accommodating and went the extra mile to make our stay outstanding. The room was well appointed, comfortable, clean and had everything we needed to make it an enjoyable weekend. We would stay again and recommend it highly.

title: Four blissful nights and days
text: We stayed four nights and found the hotel to be exceptional.  Check in was a breeze and can't say enough about the staff, especially Shenel and those at the desk at all hours. The room was spacious especially the bathroom. Really appreciated the bed's mattress and the spacious shower. The small cafe came in handy for breakfast and for evening meals and drinks. Location was good just two blocks from the subway.  For someone from a small town, the price tag was ominous but probably fair for NYC.  If you stay here, you won't regret a moment!

title: Exceptional experience at Concorde
text: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Concorde for 4 nights visiting for his birthday. The staff was friendly and check in was easy. We stayed on the 31st floor and the view was amazing. There was plenty of room for 2 people, lots of pillows and a separate soaking bathtub + shower. Rooms service was great, Sebastian provided us excellent service throughout our whole stay. Bonsai, the restaurant downstairs, had great food. It was close enough to a ton of tourist attractions without being near all the craziness at night.

title: 1000/10 would recommend staying here
text: Had the most amazing experience at the Concorde Hotel. Check in was quick and easy. The staff is incredibly kind and helpful. The room had the most amazing views. The bed and pillows were extremely comfy. Breakfast was AMAZING. Couldn’t have asked for a better experience.

title: SYED IS THE BEST! STAY HERE ITS GREAT
text: Super friendly staff and a lovely hotel! Nothing but a great experience during our first visit to NYC! Our doorman Syed made the experience even better. He was so sweet! So caring ! We love him! we will be back and we enjoyed every minute at the Concord

title: Great hotel!
text: Really nice room with incredible views. The location could not be better and there are many metro stations nearby. Water and coffee are offered by the hotel. All the staff was really nice with us, specially Sebastian who was really helpful during our journey.

title: Jonas bros. Concert trip
text: The room was very cramped and the bathroom fan or mirror didn’t work and there was black mold on the bathroom ceiling. The red haired female who checked us in was a complete snob. The only reason I would go back there is for Syed he was so amazing and super hospitable. Great person to have welcoming your hotel guest.

title: Tivemos um excelente atendimento no Hotel. Agradecemos especialmente o funcionário SYED, atencioso, honesto e educado.
text: Agradecimento especial ao funcionário SYED, que encontrou e devolveu a carteira com U$600,00 de uma amiga. Não é muito usual esse tipo de comportamento nos dias de hoje. Além disso, os quartos são excelentes, limpeza impecável e todos cordiais. Indicação certa para outras pessoas!

title: Concorde hotel is the best in NYC
text:
The Concorde hotel is our favorite hotel in NYC.
The rooms are immaculate and spacious . The service is top notch. The staff always is friendly, helpful and will go out of their way to make you feel at home. The staff really care about the clients comfort and well being. The restaurant has great food that is perfectly fresh and tasty. The Concorde also has valet parking so we don’t need to worry about anything other than our business and having fun. We also want to mention that Syed is exceptional and he will go out of his way to help you. There are many hotels in NYC. However, there is only one Concorde hot and that is where we always stay. If you are planning a trip to NYC, the Concorde is the only place to stay

title: Amazing staff Members
text:
The stay was very comfortable. Porter Syed is super amazing who gave us good information for what to do around the city, weather, etc he was always on top and step a head in guiding us to have great trip at NYC! 
Thank you Syed. Keep up the great work. 
We surely will return again. 
Sincerely 
Dee Memon

title: Oasis with the best doorman ever in a perfect walkable area
text: Best staff ever!  Incredibly comfortable room that was immaculately clean and comfortable beds.  The bathroom was beautiful in white marble with a rain shower and wand shower head. You are given Morton Brown products which are luxurious. Our favorite part was being greeted and helped by Syed. He was helpful with getting cars, giving suggestions and was an absolute joy greeting us all the time. He is a GEM for the hotel.

title: Worst Customer Service I've Ever Experienced
text: I travel from Los Angeles to NY every other month. I booked this hotel on booking.com. My flight to NY was cancelled - I could not get to the city. I was only going for two days so I chose not to go. I would not have arrived until the night the event I was attending was over. The airlines refunded my ticket but this hotel charged me a full nights fee for my late cancellation. I have never experienced anything like this when it comes to hotel services. I gave them the flight information and they could have confirmed that my story was true. I was repeatedly told, "it was their policy." I understand policies. I write policies. However, extenuating circumstances typically allow for room in any policy. They literally simply pocketed a one night stay, which was approximately $450. As I spoke to people up the chain of management, the only response I received was, "that's our policy." No one could have an actual conversation. At the very least, I could have been offered some sort of credit for a future stay. Hope the $450 helped them somehow because it made a difference to me. Be aware of their unyielding, customer service.

title: Great Hotel!
text:
I love this hotel.  Its location at 55th & Lex is perfect whether I'm traveling for business or for fun.  The hotel has this hushed, sleek European vibe that I really like. The rooms are quite spacious (I always reserve the Premier King but I have stayed in other rooms and they are just as wonderful) and they have plenty of storage and built-ins for luggage storage, etc.  But what makes the rooms so wonderful are the bathrooms -- loads of countertops both at the sink and in the shower and there is a separate soaking tub that I really enjoy!  
There are only four rooms to a floor and the layout is designed so that no room is up against another room so the rooms are very quiet. 
The staff is quite friendly, especially Sandy, who goes out of her way to make every guest feel special.  
This is my home away from home when I'm in NYC!

title: Good place
text:
Nice place. Centered. Good and convenient room. Three recommendations:
- do something about very loud room doors (when they open or close)
- change that ridiculous paper pad holder
- have a chair with a height consistent with the office height

title: Summer Celebration
text: Visited NYC for my birthday and stayed to celebrate America’s birthday. The Concorde is a wonderful Boutique Hotel with excellent staff and a great location. The room was well appointed and housekeeping staff were very attentive. This was my first visit to Concorde but surely will not be my last! The team members on this property make every effort to insure guests are happy. I highly recommend this property for your City stay!

title: Excelente sorpresa Una joya en New york Moderno Confortable En el centro de donde es lindo partir a visitar la ciudad
text:
Magnifico Hotel Sorprendente Muy buena ubicacion Limpieza Atencion Habitacion superior la que elegi Excelente vista Tiene cafetera nexpresso El bar de desayuno perfecto Buen Wifi  , Valet  de check in amable 
De los mejores hoteles que estuve en precio muy razonable

title: Super holiday stay at the Concorde Hotel New York
text: Super stay at the Concorde hotel for a week visit to New York. All staff very helpful and friendly. Special mention to Sandy and Jeaninie and front of house.Great location for a family holiday or business stay

title: Best hotel team ever!
text:
Review

Amazing! But when I say amazing I genuinely mean amazing and specifically I am referring to the staff. The hotel was in a great location easy to get to and a good base to use for sightseeing downtown as well as uptown. 

The room was spectacular we had a suite with a triple aspect window. Oh and the blinds were motorised, nice touch. Didn’t always work and you had to do it twice but still cute. 

The hotel was always clean and well looked after. We met Sebastian who was constantly working and making sure all areas of the hotel were spotless. Never saw him standing still, he was a delight to talk to and always said hi no matter how busy he was. We felt he went above and beyond out of his way to engage with us and helped us when room service failed to turn our room with fresh towels and toiletries. 

Talking of room service, this is unfortunately where the hotel failed us. We were there for a week and room service failed/refused to service our room for 3 days in a row. We had to keep asking reception to talk to the service team to turn our room and they didn’t. The hotel management really need to re evaluate their service contract with this external provider as they are seriously letting down all the good the hotel team do. It’s not fair. 

As for the rest of the staff. We were met at reception by Ajla and Chris. The two of them went onto become our best friends for the duration of our stay. A friendly smile and greeting every morning and help with absolutely everything and anything we asked. Restaurant recommendations and reservations, assistance with a medical issue. Their prompt responses when we had not one but two chairs fail in the room. Note to the management, those egg chairs may look nice but they are not stable I fell off one on one evening and my partner fell of the other a few nights later they snapped at the weld point. Not good. 

However back to the review. So even though we had a couple of issues we would absolutely recommend this hotel not just for all the great things that we experienced but mostly for the staff and how they rose to the occasions when faced with a challenging issue. Ajla stood out from everyone as the most experienced and knowledgeable and don’t get us wrong we really enjoyed interacting with Chris and Sebastian and Sayed, but we feel like Ajla made extra time for us and that she went even more above and beyond her duties. I hope the management read this as you have a gem there and I hope you look after her and the rest. We plan on coming back and we hope to see them all again. 

Wishing you all the best from London. 
We’ll bring extra chocolates next time and seriously change your room service contract. Don’t let one cost saving contract ruin the hotel reputation or all the good things your actual staff do.

title: Brunch at Bonsaii
text: Had brunch at Bonsaii, Juan Esteban our server was great! He was super attentive and helpful. Presentation was beautiful, and food was delicious. Avocado toast was my favorite. Cappuccino was picture perfect!

title: Our vacation in NYC
text:
It was a wonderful experience my stay at Concorde Hotel.
My room was so nice and comfortable with an amazing view on the skylines. I was at the 25th floor and spent a few days with my husband for our wedding anniversary. The staff was so gentle with us, so human and professional. Such a great experience! We’d like to thank also Syed, the man who assisted us for our luggage and for the taxi. Thank you to all of us ! See you sure next year! We’ll be back!
Antonella and Michele from Italy

title: Be better
text: Have some empathy for your customers. Wouldn’t even let me discuss an issue my mother had with a reservation and late greedy to take money for a service they didn’t even provide. I’ve never seen service like this in the hospitality industry.

title: Highly recommended they restaurant
text:
Every year I travel to this beautiful city, from Dublin, and for a year now Bonsaii has become a must visit, Bonsaii is the garden of Eden in the middle of the chaotic concrete jungle, I loved seeing its yearly progress , and this year they pleasantly surprised me with a more extensive and varied menu, everything I tried was delicious, you can see the love they put into what they do.
The service is excellent, all the staff is very attentive and friendly, at all times watching our table, refilling our water glasses before the glass is empty, giving us recommendations, It was a quality service at the level of this beautiful place.
 I highly recommend this restaurant and I'm dying to go back to Manhattan to be surprised again with their delicious news on their menu

title: A ten out of ten stay
text: extremely cozy and comfortable bed/pillows (which is rare nowadays), everything was clean and the staff was very professional and nice. Sandy gave us and amazing welcome and made sure we were settling in well. Thanks Sandy! Lastly, their food downstairs at Bonsai is amazing.

title: Charming boutique hotel that offers spacious rooms in an attractive setting!
text: It was our first time staying at the Concorde and we enjoyed our experience. The hotel is in a great location and is a gem. The room was spacious, clean, comfortable, and offered an excellent view. The staff are very accommodating especially the front office supervisor, Estefania Badillo who assisted us making our stay magical. I highly recommend this boutique property that offers a relaxing and charming atmosphere and so close to all the NYC Broadway shows and restaurants! We plan to return soon!

title: Great mid-town hotel moderately priced
text: Great modern rooms. Great people working there. Great East side location. Close to everything. Good for business or pleasure. Try to get a room with the outside terrace. Very spacious. Great little Bistro attached.

title: Great hotel and great staff in the middle of everything!
text: This hotel is fully renovated, clean, centrally located, and has an excellent staff willing to go the extra mile to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. We stayed at the Concorde for almost 2 weeks and Sebastian took great care of us, making sure we felt at home and had everything we needed at all times. We will definitely be back soon and will recommend this gem to all our friends. Thank you Sebastian!

title: Everything you need at a Manhattan hotel
text: This boutique hotel is super clean, up to date, centrally located and the service is outstanding.  The midtown-east is a perfect location and very safe at walking distance to UN, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and museums and good restaurants. Restaurant service is limited but breakfast is good and the Bonsai terrace is good for a cocktail.  I will book again!

title: Excellent Stay very nice staff, nice lobby, nice rooms
text: Staff is very helpful and competent. Super location to reach everything. Area is not too busy. Lounge and rooms are nice. Price/performance ratio is very good. Fridge, safe, ironing board and iron are in the room. A special breakfast-bar is also there.

title: Excellent boutique hotel
text: Very nice rooms. Front desk was great, especially Sandy and Estefania. Very friendly and helpful . They made me feel so welcome The location is very convenient. Bed and bedding was extremely comfortable.

title: Sandy
text:
The staff are really friendly especially (Sandy) and ( Estefania). They are great and welcoming with nice smiles. Also the location of the hotel is great and safe, near to the Central Park and 5th Av. 
Sandy, again she was helpful and gave us a lot of information and advice to enjoy and stay safe.

title: Very high value!
text: Great location! Clean, comfortable and high speed elevators! Really nice bathrooms, comfortable beds. Reasonably priced! Couldn’t hear any street noise from our room. The staff exceeded all of our expectations and that is a rarity. So glad we found it! Going to be our hotel destination in our future trips to New York!

title: Soluzione perfetta per NYC
text: Uno degli hotel più belli e comodi che ho mai provato nelle mie vacanze. La posizione è ottima perché permette di girare a piedi tantissimi posti (da Central Park fino all'Empire State Building) ed è molto ben collegata anche con la metro. L'hotel è davvero stupendo, sembra nuovo, e adoro lo stile con il quale è arredato, ma questo lo potete già valutare dalle immagini. Check-in e check-out velocissimi con uno staff super cortese. Al terzo piano è presente una palestra e servizio caffè/cappuccino gratuito 24 ore su 24. Le camere sono molto belle e pulitissime. Avevamo una camera queen (quindi quella base) davvero eccezionale e la vista dal 28 piano era una meraviglia. Molto apprezzabile che il grattacielo sia stretto e alto, così per ogni piano ci sono sostanzialmente 4 camere. Ascensori molto veloci e funzionali, non abbiamo mai fatto coda, e questo è molto importante a New York. Insomma lo straconsiglio!!!

title: Lovely stay but I won't come back
text:
5th time in this beautiful city and it's probably the best Hotel I stayed in. The standart room was big enough,  cozy and most of time clean. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom with the shower and bath was excellent. Most of the Hotel team was kind and friendly, some of them less. Chris fron the reception was very helpful, always with a smile and willing to help. Then why I Raye it low? Because of the check out time. After 11 days in this Hotel I was sure they will allow me to check out at 3pm instead of 11am. At first I got a negative answer.  After that I was allowed to stay until 12 o'clock free of charge and if I want to stay until 2 o'clock in the afternoon then the cost is $75 without taxes and if I want to stay until 3 o'clock then the cost will be an extra night.  It's ridiculous, absurd and of course I didn't agree.  Chris spoke with the receptionist who said I could stay until 1pm at no extra charge and the matter could not be discussed further.  At 1 o'clock I left the room and waited about 4 minutes for the elevator (which is a disaster!!).  While waiting I heard the phone in the room ringing, probably to find out why I hadn't left the room yet, 3 minutes after the departure time. Seriously? 3 minutes? 
So I did the check out and the woman was so unfriendly without asking me how was my stay or wishing me a good travel or whatever. This is not a service you give to people, sorry.
That's why you deserve this 1.

title: An exceptional comfortable stay in NYC with amazing staff.  Perfect location!
text: The hotel is small but perfectly formed - no frills per se, but exceptionally clean and comfortable with everything you need for a very pleasant stay. The hotel is in an excellent location and it felt very safe - within a 20 minute walk of Times Square. Our room was a great size. We had a studio, so therefore we had a separate bedroom for us and our 'grown' children shared the sofa bed. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was large with a wonderful vista of the area. The staff were fantastic and I have to mention Sebastien in particular - friendly, personable and a willingness to help - all with a permanent smile on his face. He couldn't have been more helpful and welcoming and went over and above to make our stay extremely pleasurable with his friendly demeanour and lovely chats. The staff in Bonsai - the restaurant/cafe, were exceptional and so professional with outstanding service. We had three different servers and they were all equally attentive. A slight maintenance issue was resolved by Jason, who was extremely courteous and very pleasant. We had a birthday whilst here and a card and chocolates were left in the room. An Easter treat was also left in room for us. Overall an excellent stay in this hotel.  Would definitely return.

title: Great views
text:
Best view in NYC. Close to everything you could possibly want. Friendly staff.

 Shower heads facing the shower door is a weird choice but you get used to it. Need one more sentence for two hundred character minimum.

title: Excellent stay, great room. Sandy is the best!
text: It was my first experience at the Concorde Hotel. The hotel is really nice - I had a great room with a view. Sandy from the staff was fantastic : friendly, smily & funny. She made my stay even more nicer.

title: Excellent Stay, Friendly People, Nice Room, I will Return
text: It was my first experience at the Concorde hotel.  The staff was friendly, the hotel was nice and the experience positive.  I travel almost every week, stay at lots of hotels, this is nicer than the cookie cutter "M" hotels that I typically stay in as I travel.  The location is excellent too.

title: Quite a flawless stay in a spacious and new hotel
text:
I cannot point out anything bad about this hotel. And I have thought about it hard too. 

PROS:

Great location - walk distance to many places 
Many food and drink options nearby 
Whole foods / Duane reade nearby 
Subway station nearby 
Spacious rooms - the biggest I’ve experienced for an NYC room (we could open up 3 suitcases at a time)
Coffee machine / microwave / fitness centre available and a big table on the 3rd floor - we got together to eat our takeout there 
Spacious bathroom 
Friendly staff 

CONS:
Like I said, it’s really hard to think of any. 
Probably we were so in love with this hotel that we wanted to cancel our second hotel and continue with this one (as we had a 4 day break in Canada and back to NY) and they didn’t really look into extending any special rate to us to be able to switch hotels, which I feel they could have looked into it, but told us to book online instead. 

In the end, we didn’t switch hotels as we would have had to fork out more than a hundred extra per night. We were sorely disappointed with the size of the second hotel. 

But we will definitely stay here again should we ever return to NYC.

title: Experiencia en Bonsaii tapas bar.
text:
Estuve con mis amigos en bonsaii aquel restaurante que está en el lobby del hotel y la comida es espectacular el lugar es súper ameno y se vive una experiencia increíble. 
El servicio es de 10/10 Andrés quien nos atendió que chico tan servicial y pendiente de absolutamente todo. 
100% recomendado.

title: Excelente localização
text:
Hotel muito bem localizado, limpo, confortável, bar que oferece café da manhã com muitas opções e preços justos! 
Cama confortável, funcionários atenciosos e educados!
Ficarei nesse hotel certamente quando retornar a NY

title: Worst hotel I’ve stayed at in NYC
text:
I travel often to New York for work, and like to try different hotels out each visit. I really wish I hadn’t tried Concorde Hotel. It is supposedly a “4 star” institution, but to be honest it is nothing close to that. 

Upon arrival, as a single woman traveller, I expected at the very least to get some help with my large luggage. I didn’t even get the door opened for me. Usually, when you pay this much for a hotel, the staff at least offer to help with the door (or your bags). 

When I got to the desk all I wanted was some room service, I’d travelled 10 hours that day and to my unpleasant surprise - the hotel doesn’t offer room service. I get to my room and find an empty mini fridge (no bottled water, no snacks). The lights on the bathroom mirror don’t work, and the lighting panel by the bed is faulty. 

I realised I forgot my adaptor plug, I ring down to see if they have one. They did, but refused to bring it up to my room and insisted I come downstairs to sign a waiver in order to use it… I found this ridiculous, and no other hotel I’ve ever stayed at has staff which are so unhelpful that they can’t even bring something to the room to help you out. I was happy to sign their document, but surely this could have been brought up to the room…?

I wanted to watch some TV, and then to my (now entirely expected) disappointment, you have to download an app and pay for a subscription in order to stream TV. No other hotel I’ve ever stayed at has charged for this very basic service. 

The rooms are not well soundproofed and unfortunately the man staying in the room next door kept me up all night with his coughing. Also the doors of the rooms slam so loudly that you’re woken up if the person next door leaves or enters their room. 

The gym is very basic, one of the two treadmills didn’t work during my stay which was frustrating. 

I have another upcoming trip soon which I’d also booked at Concorde, and I went to the front desk in attempt to cancel the booking. I was told by the man that since I booked through booking.com I had to go through them. When this was an unsuccessful request, my colleague called the hotel for me to try and plead with them to let me cancel and have a refund because the hotel was so massively disappointing. She received very rude and unprofessional treatment from the woman on the phone saying there was “no record of me trying to cancel before” which is completely false. Generally, I found the staff here to be unhelpful and wanting to do only the bare minimum. For the price of this hotel, there are infinitely better options out there. Don’t make the same mistake as me and be sucked in by the nice pictures online, in reality the hotel looks and feels cheap, and the service matches.

title: Excelent hotel, location just perfect, hotel very clean.
text: Excellent hotel, very cleans with a great location, easy to get around the city, the restaurant it was good too we’ve been there 3 times for dinner and with great staff special thanks for Sandy from the front desk and Otavio were outstanding.

title: Great Time @ Concorde
text: Large spacious room, very clean. Beautiful view of Manhattan. Sandy Jeannie and all the staff are very kind and helpful. Great time spent in Manhattan. Also the bistrot "Bonsaii" it was a very good discovery.

title: So wonderful
text: So lovely, comfortable, friendly staff, great location, comfortable room and bedding. Sebastian from the staff was particularly wonderful, and kept the business lounge and gym spotless all day - recommend it

title: Great place in NYC
text:
Very nice and clean hotel.
Staff was very kind, we had a small issue with the room and Sebastian was very helpful and welcoming.
Rooms are pretty new and spacious.

Definitely a good place to stay in New York City.

title: Great stay!
text: What a great hotel! Went to New York for a quick 3-day trip to see my twenty-something granddaughter and couldn’t have picked a better hotel. Centrally located, wonderful beds, the best feather pillows ever (but they offered a choice of foam, too) and THE most fabulous view from our 25th floor room (attached). The room was spacious, spotlessly clean, beautifully appointed and had all the usual amenities (coffee, ironing board, robe, large flat-screen TV and LOTS of storage space). They offered free coffee, espresso, tea and divine hot chocolate on the third floor any time you wanted it. Sandy was the staff person at the front desk and couldn’t have been nicer or more helpful. All in all, a terrific stay and I couldn’t imagine staying anywhere else on my next trip to New York.

title: Former New Yorker makes this home base every visit
text: My wife and I are frequent guests at the Concorde Hotel NY. It is very clean and the staff is very well trained. We feel welcomed and all our concerns have been appropriately handled. On our last visit, Sandy, at the front desk was particularly helpful with our check in. From then on Sandy greeted us by name each time we passed by and asked if we were enjoying our visit and if there was anything she could do for us. We’ve already made a reservation for our next NYC trip. Thanks to the entire staff.

title: Favorite Five Star Front Desk Reception
text:
Avalon and Liz at the front desk know how to take care of their guests.  Ironically, the customer service at the front desk was our most discussed memory from our December holiday weekender.  Covering the Eastern U.S. visiting up to seven states a week has me living out of a suitcase with a keen eye out for hotels featuring phenomenal customer service after having stayed at as many forty hotels in Manhattan.  

The Concorde is now my only hotel of choice in NYC.  The front desk at many midtown hotels rivals what many describe as being treated by prison guards.  Some ponder that it’s due to the unions, but all agree that management is who makes the difference.  

The supersonic speed at which the front desk was able to accommodate a special request with grace and discretion really set themselves apart.  Customer service may matter more to me than the actual property, but this hotel is across the street from a block-long church, so it’s super quiet on any floor while still being in the heart of the City.

title: A very good surprise in New York
text:
We didn’t know anything about this hotel and It was a very good surprise!
Extremely well located, we’ve been kindly welcomed by the team.
Spacious and clean room, located on the 31st floor (we didn’t have problems with the elevator).
Wonderful view!
Good memories!

title: Gorgeous, Clean, Convenient, Friendly
text:
The Concorde is the best hotel I've ever stayed at in my life. 

ROOM: I stayed in the Ambassador Parlor King room on the 37th floor, and it was GORGEOUS. Apparently the 37th floor used to be all one big 2-bedroom suite, but it was broken up into 3 rooms sometime recently. The front desk told me there is an ambassador king and an ambassador queen. The king is what was the "primary" room when it was a whole-floor suite, which means it has a massive bathroom with a tub and a huge shower. The bathroom alone is the size of most New York hotel rooms. Pretty awesome. The bedroom area is a single room, so no separate area like you think of with a "suite" if that's what you're looking for. The bed is super comfortable, the closet is a great size, and I appreciated how much drawer storage the room had. The space was designed very well and intentionally.

VIEW: The Ambassador Parlor King faces north and has a lovely view of several buildings. I loved how you felt like you were among the skyscrapers, but you weren't just staring into another building up-close. It was exactly the view I was hoping for.

CLEANLINESS: I read another review about how clean the rooms are, and I can confirm this!!! Hotel rooms usually have a little grime hiding in the corners or in the tile grout, but this room was so clean, it looked brand new. We chatted with the housekeeping ladies in the mornings in the elevator and they are SO sweet. 

LOCATION: I usually stay in lower Manhattan for the vibrancy so I was worried about feeling isolated in the UES, but I actually really loved the location. Several convenient subway stops nearby, and it's a quick 15-20 minute walk to the park/5th Ave shops, etc. 

HOTEL/SERVICE: Everyone who worked here was so nice, from Abdul at the bell desk to the front desk staff. The little restaurant in the back is cute although we didn't eat there. The lobby was really cool, and the lobby bathroom was super nice and clean and a good place to freshen up if you need to before your room is ready. 

Overall, I can't say enough great things about The Concorde Hotel. I can't wait to come back again.

title: BUEN HOTEL EN MAHATTAN
text: Muy buen hotel. Excelente ubicación. Recepción ágil y servicial. Siempre un miembro del staff está disponible para responder las dudas. Todos correctos, y el mejor es Barry (ídolo!!!). Responden rápido ante los imprevistos: una pérdida en el baño la repararon en dos horas. Habitaciones impecables. Frigo bar vacío!: con espacio para que el huésped ponga lo que necesita. Hay plancha para la ropa. Hay cafetera y renuevan las cápsulas a diario. Muy cómoda la cama. La habitación podría tener algún cajón más pero para estadías cortas está bien. La señora que limpia la habitación es muy eficiente y agradable. En el Piso 3, Agua e infusiones disponibles 24:00 horas. Buen gimnasio con toallas y agua. En el piso 31 teníamos una bonita vista de Mahattan.

title: Another excellent stay
text: I recently stayed at the Concorde Hotel for a second time and, once again, I really enjoyed my stay. The location is perfect: the hotel is very central and close to all the midtown sites. My south-facing room had a great view and was quite spacious. (I also loved the bed sheets.)  The staff were exceedingy pleasant, even on this very busy Thanksgiving weekend, and gave me my room several hours early. In short, this is just a very well run, friendly and comfortable place to stay. And the price, by NYC standards, was good too.

title: Great location, staff and rooms
text:
Hotel consists of 120 rooms (4 per floor).  The king room we had was large (and huge by NY standards). Modern, clean and well appointed-large shower, separate tub, desk, “window seat” and a place to spread out luggage.

Lobby is small but airy and cute. In house restaurant was great to grab dinner. 

Staff: attentive and pleasant. We especially enjoyed the bellman/doorman Barry. He always welcomed us with a warm greeting as we were coming and going and was ready to help with suggestions, taxi, storing luggage etc.  He made us feel as if we were coming home each time we returned to the hotel.

title: Top location
text:
Good location in the centre of Manhattan - rooms a little bit loud (traffic) - Barry is one of the best Concierge i have met so far…
Good restaurants near the hotel - nice christmas trip with my famiöy

title: Stadsbezoek
text: Goed en centraal gelegen hotel in Manhattan , vriendelijke bediening , zeer klantgericht met speciale vermelding voor Barry , zeer gedienstig , empathisch en oplossingsgericht ..Het hotel heeft zelf geen restaurant wat we niet zagen als een tekortkoming gezien de vele opties in de omgeving. Dit deel van de stad heeft ook het voordeel van een goede nachtrust daar het toch een iets rustigere straat was.

title: Staff saved idiot husband
text: I managed to somehow double book the room through a third party app - both bookings were non-refundable- Sandy Ivana was so helpful in figuring out a solution. I was able to rebook for another weekend, saving me both money and more importantly, a scolding from my wife.

title: Incredible staff!
text: Great location and property, but by far the best part was the incredible attentiveness and warmth of the staff. Sandy & Ivan at the front desk were particularly helpful, and their humor and thoughtfulness made every interaction a pleasure.

title: My Go To NYC Hotel
text: I go to NYC at least once per quarter on business. I always stay here! It is not luxurious but clean and centrally located. The staff is also top notch. Special shoutout to my two favorite girls Sandy and Ivana. They always greet me with a smile and a "welcome back - let us know if you need anything at all". You can teach service like this.

title: Could be better
text: Booked a premium king based on the hotel's room description that mentioned "stunning views of NYC" for this room category. Even put in a request for a high floor. Got a room on a low floor with a view of a wall. Air quality in the room was very poor, had terrible allergies while inside.

title: Excellent place to stay, spacious rooms
text: I was here with my daughter for four nights in October.  The rooms are extremely comfortable and very spacious by NYC standards.  There's a nice bar/breakfast area and a decent gym which a good complimentary coffee machine on hand.  I had a billing problem (caused by me) and the staff were really helpful sorting it out after the stay.  Highly recommended

title: Terrible
text:
The Concorde Hotel has to be the worst hotel, with the comfiest bed, I have ever stayed in. The customer service is an alien concept to them, I would not recommend it at all. 

There's very little hot water, the shower leaks and housekeeping all go home at 3, should you ever need fresh towels at 3.05, you'll be dissapointec

title: Fabulous!!
text: Wonderful stay at the Concorde!  It's a no frills hotel in terms of not having all the hotel usual amenities but we missed nothing by staying at this fabulous hotel!  Super clean and spacious for travel with family.  The restaurant downstairs (available for pick up) is delicious!!!!!  Ideal location....within walking distance to most things you want to see in Manhattan.  Friendly staff and great daily cleaning service.  The bathtub and shower are HUGE!  We will stay here again on our next visit!!!!

title: Excellent service, rooms and location
text:
This is a beautiful hotel, perfectly located in Midtown, with the best service I have ever experienced! 

While Covid has caused many hotels to reduce their service, that is not the case at the Concorde. From housekeeping (thanks Zumreta) to the front desk (thanks Kiara) to the busboys (thanks Sebastian), they have a terrific team in place. 

Everyone who I have encountered has been attentive and helpful. Management should be really proud of the job they are all doing. I can’t recommend this hotel more highly.

title: Hospitality at its best!
text: Perfect upper east side location. A Nespresso machine in the room always makes me smile. The room was sparkling clean neat and organised. Sandy at the front desk went out of her way to accommodate us. Thank you!

title: Great hotel!
text:
Great hotel, highly recommended 
Stayed there for 9 nights and everything was terrific 
Great location
Friendly and helpful staff
Big and clean room
Close to Central Park and fifth avenue 
Prices are decent for such hotel so altogether I can say it was a great experience

title: Great vacation hub
text:
Location is perfect. Rooms felt lux. The staff really made it feel special. They were super friendly and helpful and treated us like houseguests. 

Bonus items: rain shower and deep tub. Actually good lobby restaurant. Dozens of incredible international takeout spots within 2 blocks, as well as plenty of fancier sit down options.

title: Amazing actitude on  caring their guests!
text:
I want to sincerely give my thanks to the operation manager, Mrs. Rada Draskovic and her team, for his exceptional and amazing way of caring their guests comfort. 

I’ll definitely be back. ❤️ 

Kind regards to the Concorde Hotel!!

Franco Pistoia

title: Amazing experience!
text:
I loved my stay in the Concorde Hotel for so many reasons: 
1. The location is perfect, midtown Manhattan.
2. The rooms are SO clean and new with a very modern finished look.
3. The view from our room was stunning.
4. In the lobby they have a beautiful cafe with the most delicious breakfast and the most amazing servers. Super convenient to stay in a place where you can find good food.
I’m definitely coming back!!

title: Great, comfortable, and great staff!
text: I love this place. It was spacious, clean, and the staff was super helpful and responsive. The guys and ladies here were always ready to help and did! Thank you, Concorde, we will visit you again soon!

title: Très mauvais rapport qualité prix
text:
Dans une catégorie de prix très élevés (entre 500 et 1000 dollars en ce mois de septembre), le Concorde semble accumuler les lacunes pour réellement prétendre concurrencer les hôtels du même segment :
- équipements minimums dans la chambre (même pas une cuillère pour éventuellement manger ce aue bon vous semble)
- petit-déjeuner à la carte type Starbucks en plus cher, mais qui commence seulement à 8h
- ne cherchez pas ni ne demandez un chausse-pied, du cirage, l’hôtel est moins équipé qu’un ibis
- lobby étriqué 
- ascenseurs très lents
- personnel à la limite de l’aimable 
- lit 140 et non 160
- bruits du couloir très pesants dans la chambre
- salle de sport plus petite qu’une chambre avec les deux tapis de running en panne de toute façon 

Passons sur l’absence de peignoir (qui en dit long), et vous avez le plus mauvais rapport qualité prix d’un hôtel pourtant très bien placé.

title: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text: This is a great hotel and customer service. I’ve stayed in a one bedroom suite which is very spacious and has great views to a beautiful church. The amenities like tea, coffee and filtered water was a plus. A big thanks to Rada for everything.

title: Frustrating experience in a good location
text: I’m not one to write reviews. But I was disappointed by many things with my stay. First off, for a hotel that almost $800 a night, they are lacking in luxuries to justify the price. No room service (although there is a room service button on the phone) no mini bar, no waters in the room. Bathroom amenities were disappointing. No q tips or cotton, hair dryer was small and older model. Today I called at 11:30 & asked for housekeeping to clean the room. When I returned at 4, it was not done. At 5, I was in the shower and housekeeping didn’t knock, they just walked straight in…I quickly covered myself and she brought extra towels. To her credit, she was so mortified and very kind. She was not the problem.  I then called downstairs to ask for the room to be cleaned while we went to dinner. I was told that housekeeping had already left for the day and there was nothing they could do to accommodate me. In a luxury hotel, there is always housekeeping. I spoke to front desk supervisor who had no empathy and didnt seem to care much about my complaints. Again this is hotel charging 800-900 a night. It doesn’t warrant the price. Which is sad because the location is great and the room was nice. I think if you are going to charge that much money, certain amenities and services are necessary.  And if the front desk supervisor had just showed some remorse and offered to fix some of these things, I would have been happy. Instead she was blaming the housekeeping staff. Management starts at the top. Accept responsibility, have sone customer service and make things right.

title: Disappointing
text:
Not suitable for business travellers. 
No room service 
Breakfast (very basic and very few seats available) starts at 8
Only two elevators available for the entire hotel
When I checked out one was broken, it took me 15 min to get to reception 
On top of all of these, too expensive 
No value for money
Never again

title: 뉴욕에서 좋은 호텔
text:
뉴욕에서 처음 방문한 호텔!!
체크인시간 3시인데 조금 넘어서 해주었고 
전반적으로 방도 전망있는 좋은방이였고 아래에 있는 베이커리 카페도 좋았어요~~
편안하게 지내기 좋았는데 프론트 직원들이 조금만 더 친절하면 더 좋을것같아요~~~

title: Highly recommended
text:
I cannot recommend this hotel enough, we absolutely loved it!
Great location, easy walk to Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Times Square.
Our room was on the 25th floor and had amazing views, it was really quiet and a very good sized room.
The bathroom was beautiful and so so clean. 
The bed was exceptionally comfortable and the air conditioning was amazing and very controllable (we needed it as it was very hot during our stay)
There was a little fridge in the room which was great for keeping water, wine and beer cold. There was a liquor store around the corner, they had a fabulous selection of wines. 
On the fourth floor there is a cold water machine and a lovely coffee machine, you can help yourself all day.
There was also a lovely coffee machine in the room, pods were replaced daily for us.
Alfred on the door was so kind to us on our last day, storing our cases and arranging a taxi for us to the airport.
I have no negatives at all about this hotel, it was exceptionally clean, welcoming and a real haven after a long day sightseeing. I absolutely cannot wait to visit again if I am lucky enough to stay in New York again. 
Thank you for a really lovely stay 😊

title: Lovely hotel in the heart of midtown manhattan
text:
We did two stops at this hotel in NY during our US visit. I usually stay at other hotels close by but chose the Concorde due to reviews and location and a newer feel. Loved our stay! King room first few days and then a week in the junior suite. Great facilities, lovely staff and special thanks to Sandy and Ivanna. The bar/restaurant is attached to the hotel with a lovely courtyard in the back, with very nice breakfast and bites and also drinks. Staff in the restaurant also very helpful and friendly. You do need to pay separately at the restaurant despite being in the hotel—which is odd but fine, but I think the hotel management can sort this out and allow charging to the room. Front door gentleman Faoud also a very nice chap! 

There’s no room service in the hotel but we didn’t really have an issue. Gym is small but since I was the only one whenever I used it, worked fine for me! Machines new and good. 

Location is superb. Will stay again whenever we visit.

title: excellent boutique hotel
text: Nice hotel midtown east hotel (walking distance to everything )without crazy amenities (no fancy lounge no room service) but larger than avg. comfortable clean rooms nice bathrooms, and very pleasant service.(staff very friendly and accomidative)

title: clean Hotel, good location, friendly staff, lovely rooms
text:
I can only recommend this hotel. We stayed there for 2 nights with our little daughter and had a very good time. Amenities were very clean, the size of our room was very generous, we had a great view but the noise level was so low, it was very quiet. 

Location was good too, a lot of lovely restaurants around with very good food. 

We will definitely stay there again.

title: Moving to Manhattan
text:
I just moved to Manhattan from London, and booked to stay at The Concorde for my first 3 weeks in the city, whilst I found my apartment. Moving to any new city can be daunting, but moving to New York is a whole different ballgame! And no matter how good or bad my day was at any point, I actually felt as though I was arriving home every time I arrived back to the hotel. 
“How was your day?” was the first question I was asked every time by Sandy, and not just as a courtesy… Sandy actually wanted to know how my day had been and how I was. 
It felt to me that every single one of the staff members at this hotel are here because they love it here. And their love for it only makes you love the hotel as a guest even more. From the moment the front doors are opened for you, through to concierge, your initial accompanied visit to your room, the housekeeping staff, the staff at the restaurant … Everyone is so open, so friendly, and so welcoming. 
I honestly can’t fault a thing and I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to New York. 
On top of this, the rooms are spacious (and spotless), the hotel is so well located, there is a gym and business suite onsite, and the restaurant downstairs serves delicious food! 
10/10 from me. And a special thanks to Sandy, the housekeeping staff and the staff at the restaurant for being so lovely to me throughout my stay.

title: Amazing Hotel and Staff
text: I love staying at the Concorde whenever I’m in the city because I know I’ll be in good hands. Right off the bat, you walk into a beautiful lobby that smells good and has staff ready at your service. They have always been readily to accompany in any way such as holding my bags while I walk around the city or if I needed more toiletries. On top of this, they have a nice security system for the elevator that no other hotel I’ve seen has which makes me feel safer while I’m in the city. Then the rooms are just so clean and wonderful to stay in. The beds are always tidy and very comfortable, the view from your room’s large window is breathtaking, and the bathrooms are sparkling. It’s truly a pleasure to stay at the Concorde and I won’t stay anywhere else!

title: Great business hotel experience; fantastic staff!
text: This hotel, between Lex & Park on 55th is in an ideal location and has been newly renovated. Until a few years ago, it was strictly reserved for British Airlines pilots/staff.
