It’s a narrow, tall building with great views and only four rooms per floor, maximum. Although amenities are limited, there’s plenty nearby to see and do, including many dining options. The staff was very professional and the rooms were spectacularly clean. The lobby staff were ultra nice as well. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a 2-person stay in midtown east, NYC.

title: Beautiful hotel & excellent service!
text:
My husband and I were in NYC to celebrate our anniversary. I was so impressed with the ambiance of this lovely hotel! The view from the room was amazing, and the size of the room was impressive for a downtown hotel.

Sandy and Kiara at the front desk were so friendly and accommodating during our stay. It was a pleasure to speak with them each evening when we returned from the day’s activities. They were so knowledgeable about the hotel amenities and the events in the area. 

I would definitely recommend this hotel, and I cannot wait to return!

title: What a gem!
text: What a gem of a place we found in the Concorde Hotel! The hotel is quaint and quiet in a perfect location in Manhattan. The rooms were clean, well decorated and very comfortable. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Sandy and Kiara went above and beyond to make sure our stay was memorable! Thanks for making our family vacation a memorable one. We will be back!

title: We look forward to our stays at Concorde.
text:
Concorde has a great midtown location, walking distance to business meetings, museums, great dining, and shops. The hotel welcomes a varied clientele, young travelers, persons on business, and families, a nice balance of domestic snd international guests. The hotel is clean and modern, the rooms are quiet and spacious, showers are terrific and we have had some great views of the city. The hotel service is first class and without exception staff is courteous, professional, and efficient. Special thanks to Sandy, Nerma, Jessie, and Jacob.
Bonsaii, the wine bar/tapas restaurant and breakfast shop off the main lobby is terrific particularly if you’re getting in late or starting early. Enjoy!

title: Perfect for a NYC trip
text:
The hotel location was perfect for tourists in NYC. You are right in the middle of the action, and within minutes of Central Park and 5th Ave. It's also very close to all major subway lines.
The room and bathroom were very big for New York, with the staff very kind and ready to offer help with our questions. The hotel was also very clean and comfortable.
There is a really small restaurant on site, which serves tapas style meals- which was very tasty.
The only negative was the quite expensive 'resort fee' that was hidden in the small print when I booked. It had to be paid "to use the hotel facilities"- which really are the restaurant (which you must pay to eat at) and the bedrooms (which again we had already paid for). Otherwise- I would recommend the Concorde Hotel, and would consider staying there again.

title: A fantastic week
text:
We loved our little home for a week!
Location is great, the stuff super friendly and helpful, the coffee at the beautiful Terrace of the little restaurant superb, all is very  clean, rooms have  a good size and enough space to store  clothes, the bed is super comfy and the sheets are soft.
And the best, it is for Manhatten pretty quiet, we slept well!
We will stay here again when we come back to NYC

title: Excellent!
text: Great, friendly, and helpful staff. Spotless rooms (even got a free upgrade) and a great location. We were heading out and it was looking like rain, so the doorman offered use of a hotel umbrella. They do a great job of welcoming guests and making you comfortable. The room was large for NYC, bright, modern and clean. Nice bathroom, too. Can't say enough good things. Will definitely stay here again. Oh, and the price was reasonable.

title: Mostly Pros, Few Cons for Concorde Hotel!
text:
I thoroughly enjoyed by stay at the Concorde Hotel. 

My room was clean and filled with light. I loved the spaciousness of my room and the pretty amazing neverending window with its view of Manhattan, facing south, as well as a smaller window facing East with a splotch of blue in the distance, the East River. I never got tired of watching the movement of life below during the day (people hanging out on their balconies, eating, doing yoga exercises, reading) and the play of the lights at night. Hard to believe, but the windows are sound-insulated! I kid you not when I say that New York’s permanent street noise could not be heard when the windows were closed, at least not on the 22nd floor. 

A small fridge as well as an espresso machine in each room and a coffee machine in the business room area across from the fitness room with various coffee concoctions,  hot chocolate and tea, were nice extras. 

The staff, from housekeeping to reception to the bell attendants, were always friendly and eager to help. The café-bar, Bonsai, is definitely a useful touch. The wine was excellent and Rubin, one of the owners, is a real charmer. 

Seriously? It’s hard to say where there was room for improvement. It’s hard, but I CAN think of a few things. 

The desk was too high! You may think this is a strange fault, but if you’re shortish, like me, measuring in at 5 feet 4, a rather normal height for a woman actually, sitting at a desk that is higher than your chest makes you feel like a toddler sitting with the grown-ups. Plus, it makes it hard to work on a laptop and even to drink a cup of coffee or snack on a quick sandwich. I suggest desk chairs that can be regulated in height or just higher chairs. This is another way in which women are inadvertantly discriminated against when furnishing hotel rooms.

The air conditioner was easy to control and did its job, but I couldn’t find a setting that really worked for me. Either it was too cold or a little too warm. I relented and kept it cooler and threw a wool shawl over my shoulder that I happened to take along with me. 

The furniture was in fairly good condition, although I found it surprising that the bathroom door was rotting on the length of its entire bottom edge. I imagine the bathroom was at one point flooded with water (now how did that happen?!? – The shower was great and well-sealed). The door was otherwise fine so they didn’t replace it, but it IS an eyesore in an otherwise pretty perfect setting.

The area outside the hotel is not a real neighborhood. 55th Street between Lexington and Park Avenues is midtown east, a business area, and not especially pretty or cool or special. On sundays some shops and stores are even closed. And just a few steps from the hotel where there is a parking garage there was a homeless man who hung out the whole week I was there, mostly sleeping. He didn’t bother anybody as far as I could see, but he was not a pleasant sight and every time I passed him I felt bad.

Despite a few hiccups, I would come back to Concorde Hotel in a heartbeat and hope to some day soon. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Perfect!
text:
Perfect! That is the word to describe my whole stay in Concorde Hotel New York.
Hotel location is really good. 
I was staying in Deluxe Room, City View, and it was really beautiful and comfortable.
Super clean room with deep soaking bath, comfy bed, Nespresso coffee machine and nice views.
Hotel customer service and housekeeping where perfect! Thank you all!
Certainly will come back if I have a change to come to New York.

title: A Great Experience
text:
My daughter just had a baby and I wanted to be relatively close to the hospital.  My first time at this hotel and it was a winner!  

Sandy and Ivana at the front desk were amazing!  Always helpful and asking if the baby had been born yet.  They made me feel comfortable and were so friendly.

Ditto on the small restaurant, whether it was dinner or breakfast.  Kevin was terrific!

My room was clean and bright with gorgeous views and a comfortable bed!  

I’ll go back, for sure.

title: A hidden Gem
text:
Great hotel with great staff. 
We stayed a couple of nights before flying back to the uk and could not fault a single thing. Room was super clean with a comfy bed. Location was fantastic a short walk to Central Park, Times Square and of course 5th Avenue.
Special mention for Abdul the hotel concierge he was an absolute star with great recommendations for restaurants and bars. Also Sandy on the front desk, we will miss your lovely smile nothing was ever to much trouble even allowing us to extend our check out.
We have stayed at a lot of hotels in Manhattan this is the 1st one that made us feel so very welcome

title: Great place!
text:
We stayed 5 nights in Concorde Hotel. The location in Manhattan is super convenient and quiet during the night even with the window opened. 
The staff is great, cleaning ladies where very polite and rooms very clean every day.
Receptionist Ivana was very helpful and polite.
Overall great place to stay if you wanna visit Manhattan for few days or more.

title: Excelent!
text: Definetily my hotel of choice in midtown Manhattan. Silent and large rooms, excellent location. Great views on 55th street east. Kind personnel, confortable beds, clean, felt like home. Absolutely recommendable!

title: Perfect
text:
We stayed one week and everything was perfect. Cleanliness, location, beautiful rooms, and an outstanding staff, Estefania was very friendly and helpful.

The room was quiet with all the amenities you need.

In our next visit to NYC, we will book this hotel again.

title: What a great place!
text: I went to NY to see family and a bit if the city. Staying in a convenient, clean, comfortable boutique type hotel was a HUGE plus. So much so, that I decided and was able to extend my stay for another two nights. The entire staff was friendly from the initial greeting of the bellman to the final goodbye at the front desk. Special thanks and kudos to Sandy and Enrique for working  hard to accommodate all my requests.  I will return in November and will definitely stay again at The Concorde. You too will like staying there. Book it!

title: Perfect hotel for a weekend in NYC
text: First stay at this hotel but not the last!  The reviews we read were spot on - friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms with lots of amenities including excellent gym and coffee bar on premises.  The room was noticeably quiet and the climate control excellent.  Rooms were pleasantly roomy by NY standards.  Good midtown location and reasonably priced.

title: Amazing rooms and Staff
text:
My visit to Concorde was a great experience! The rooms are very comfortable and spacious with a great view, a/c and a luxurious bathroom, the staff are super helpful. 
Natalie is our business partner for the company at Concorde - she is a wonderful organizer and  always helpful whenever we have special requests for our company! 
Can only recommend a stay here!

title: Excellent Choice in Convenient Location
text: It’s a small boutique style hotel (by NYC standards) with only 4 rooms per floor. Rooms are flawless, new, comfortable, clean and include nice details like complimentary coffee or tea. Large bathrooms and great views, of course in upper floors. Lobby is small but cozy, small bar and restaurant, gym, business center, all most convenient. Service is proper and attentive. Definitely a perfect choice to stay in Manhattan.

title: Lovely hotel
text: Our room was lovely, 9th floor but views were not attractive which was a shame. The beds were so comfy. Room spotlessly clean, maids always did great job cleaning and replacing things like towels etc. Our only real issue was noisy neighbours coming in slamming doors very late and waking us up. I realise hotel not responsible for people's lack of consideration but I wonder if there is anyway to stop doors banging such as soft closers. I also want to say a huge thank you to Jesse, concierge,  such a nice friendly and helpful man, yes it is his job but he was outstanding! What we brits would call a "Top Bloke". You deserve a big pay rise Jesse you are a credit to the Concorde!!

title: Great place to stay
text: Wonderfully helpful staff, and we felt really cared for. The hotel offered us everything we needed, and had fantastic staff and views.  Couldn't have been happier. We found it easy to eat either in the hotel or locally, and it is in a great position so you can walk everywhere.

title: Great Stay
text: Had to cold to the city for surgery at Sloan Kettering. Stay overnight at Concorde in a Junior suite. The room was beautiful and clean. The staff also was nice enough to hail us a cab to the hospital at 5:00 am.

title: Very good hotel and very friendly staff.
text:
Very good location and very nice rooms and mostly friendly And professional service. I plan to visit again in the future and already recommended to friends and family.
There is a nice bar that you can have a good breakfast in the morning and a good tapas bar in the evening.

title: NY
text:
Nous avons passé un excellent séjour au Concorde Hôtel. Nous pouvons que  recommander cet établissement . Très soigné, insonore et le personnel est aux petits soins. Une petite salle de sport pour les plus téméraires suite aux longues journées de marche ! 
Merci à Abdul pour le suivi effectué ! 
See you soon 👌

title: A wonderful stay
text: Perfect location, clean and elegant rooms (make sure to book the “City View” room), kind and competent staff. One minor problem is that the doors are very thin, so you can hear what’s happening in the corridor at night if guests are coming back during the night. The only other  minor issue is the bar: it opens at weird times and doesn’t have liquor for an after dinner night cap.

title: EXCELENTE HOTEL
text:
La elección de este hotel fue todo un acierto. 

La habitación magnífica, con buen tamaño, muy limpia, un cuarto de baño como a mí me gusta (bien aislado de la habitación, con muy buena ducha, independiente de la bañera, amplio lavabo con espacio para dejar las cosas, inodoro con fuerte potencia de desagüe, secador de pelo), pequeño armario para colgar la ropa, pero suficiente para una semana para dos personas, un par de cajones bajo la cama, plancha y tabla, minibar, máquina de café con las cápsulas que necesites, amplia y cómoda cama, TV, mesa y silla, caja fuerte y climatizador de aire. Y además nos asignaron dos habitaciones (éramos 4 personas) en las plantas 30 y 31 con unas vistas magnificas a los rascacielos cercanos.

El wifi funcionaba muy bien en todo el hotel, y en una de nuestras dos habitaciones, pero no en la otra. Lo indiqué nada más detectarlo y lo arreglaron de inmediato. Por lo visto hay un repetidor en cada habitación y el de nuestra habitación no estaba bien. Una vez solucionado, la velocidad fue excelente.

La ubicación era muy buena, a unos 10 minutos del Rockefeller Center y 20 de Times Square con cafeterías y restaurantes cerca y sin los agobios de estas otras zonas.

En algún comentario vi que no tenía desayuno, ni posibilidades de comida, y eso quizás fue así en el pasado, pero ahora sí que dispone de un bar cafetería donde hemos desayunado y picado algo para cenar varios días.

La amabilidad del personal de recepción y del bar es excepcional. Varias personas, tanto de recepción como del bar, hablan español. A destacar Isael, en la recepción, que nos resolvió dudas y un problema con la reserva de taxi al aeropuerto que habíamos hecho por otros medios y nos había fallado.

Muy de agradecer el servicio gratuito y 24 horas abierto en la planta 4 con una máquina de agua fresca y otra de variedad de cafés, infusiones y chocolate.

Sin duda saben cómo tratar al cliente.

Cuando volvamos a New York, lo haremos a este hotel.

Por decir algo negativo, lo único que me extrañó es que no hubiera unas zapatillas y un albornoz, pero nada de esto me parecía imprescindible y no lo pedí. Quizás si lo hubiera pedido, me lo habrían facilitado.

title: Outstanding midtown boutique hotel
text: Exceeded our expectations.  The hotel staff was excellent -  welcoming and helpful.  The decor is modern and sophisticated.  Rooms are clean, comfortable, and quiet.  Great beds, linens, A/C.  Baths are very large by NYC standards.  Excellent location.  (Our view was not great but we were on a low floor and out most of the time.)  Charming small bar and breakfast offerings off the lobby.  Will stay here again!

title: Beautiful and quiet
text: A friend booked the room, I always stay at a different brand hotel.  Was NOT disappointed.  Room was nicely decorated, clean and quiet for being in the heart of a busy city. The bathroom was large with a separate tub/shower. Very impressed and have recommended to friends.  Beds were comfortable and room was clean.  View was the only thing missing but only slept in the room so not a big deal.

title: Great hotel in upper east side
text:
Had a great stay at this newly designed and well located hotel. Staff is friendly and professional, rooms are clean and big in NY standards. Internet is fast and easy to use, and the bar/breakfast area is nice. 

All in all this was a great experience.

title: A perfect NYC hotel!
text:
I have just left The Concorde Hotel having stayed 5 nights with my daughter. We had a fabulous stay in a beautiful room with amazing views. The staff are genuinely friendly and do everything they can to make you feel at home. There is a lovely concierge team, Jacob and Jesse who are so helpful and lovely  to talk to. 
Superb location convenient to everything in mid town yet very peaceful . We will definitely be back!  10 out of 10!

title: Stayed for one night, was extremely impressed with the service. The room was clean and spacious. decor was very nice. Ni
text: Stayed for one night, was extremely impressed with the service. The room was clean and spacious. decor was very nice. Highly recommend. Great east side location. Tons of restaurants around it. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Very Quiet!
text: I would so stay here again! There are only 4 rooms to a floor so the rooms are VERY quiet. All of the staff were friendly with lots of smiles, hellos, etc.. The shower was also nice with two options - big overhead and side sprayer. Easy walk to Times Square, Central Park and 5th Avenue shopping.

title: Excellent location
text: This hotel is my new favorite in NYC. A clean, spacious, quiet boutique hotel close to Moma, Bloomingdales and the Metropolitan opera. We will certainly be back. Staff was attentive and efficient. Potentially noisy neighbors were discreetly advised of reasonable noise levels.

title: Solid but could be better
text:
The hotel was really nice overall.  It also has a good location but was a few blocks from the nearest subway.  

The front desk staff were not very friendly in my opinion - almost robotic.  I am from the Midwest so perhaps this is just a regional personality difference.  

My biggest beef with the staff is the terrible pizza joint they pointed us to when we first arrived.  It was the closest but if it was the only New York pizza we tried - I would have gone home disappointed.   

My opinion is that there are better places to stay for the $ involved.

title: une belle expérience
text: un bon hôtel , bonne gamme , bien placé tout en étant au calme , promesse tenue quand au confort et à l'a propreté, personnel d'accueil et d'entretien très agréable; sans nul doute à recommander pour son rapport qualité/prix sur collection AIR FRANCE

title: Another excellent stay at the Concorde Hotel
text: This is my favorite hotel in NYC. Rooms are nice and comfortable. Fantastic location. I loved both the food at Bonsaii and room service (Butler). But the best by far is the staff, just great people! I already made reservations to come back in November.

title: Super hotel
text: Very spacious and comfortable room in the upper floors with a great view.  Perfect location in the city and very nice personnel.  I am really looking forward to staying there again during my next trip to NYC.

title: Great stay in New York
text: I stayed here with my two adult daughters and I can’t say enough great things about this hotel. While paying the cab driver for the ride from the airport, the staff came out, got all of our luggage and escorted us to the front desk. Ivana checked us in and was friendly, kind and helpful; something I don’t see often anymore. Our room was great with an inviting spa tub and shower, beds were comfortable and all was vey quiet during our stay. I made use of the larger than expected gym, which had a good selection of equipment from which to choose. The location is perfect for touring New York; close enough to walk to Times Square, Madison Ave, etc, but also quiet and safe. The staff always said hello to us every time we returned to the hotel during our stay. They couldn’t have been more helpful or friendly. This will be my go to hotel from now on when visiting New York. I highly recommend it.

title: Great staff team
text: The hotel is brilliantly located. Close by the tube with trains both up town and down town easy to jump on. 5th avenue is less than 10 mins walk away. Rockerfella centre maybe 15 mins. When we arrived and for the whole of the trip, the front desk, concierge and cleaning team. Could not have been more polite, friendly and helpful. Okay the rooms are not enormous, but they are spotless and the view from higher floors are good ( I think you need to ask for a city view). The children had a twin room, apparently all on lower levels, they had no view. The hotel was warm, friendly and clean. We would stay here again.

title: Excellent mais bruyant
text:
L'emplacement est très bien. Situé proche de Central Park et de la 5ème avenue. Il y a un Starbucks en bas de l'hotel, un Shake Shack et une station de métro à 100m.
Le personnel est très bien, accueillant et gentil.
La chambre avec vue sur la ville au 35ème étage est très jolie, grande et le lit est confortable. La salle de bain avec baignoire et douche est très bien.
Le gros point noir de cet hotel est le bruit. Les portes claquent sans cesse à tous les étages. Et je n'exagère pas. L'isolation sonore est également insuffisante avec le couloir, on entend les gens sortir de leur chambre et discuter comme si ils étaient au bord de notre lit. Ce problème de bruit nous a vraiment gâché le séjour. C'est dommage parce que la chambre était super. Un hôtel comme celui-là devrait régler ce problème.

title: رحله واووووو جميله الاسبورت
text: شكرا الي اداره  كونكورد السلامً شرم الشيخ علي حوسنً الاستقبال والضيافه مطاعمً وبارات جميله جدا شاطي جميل اووووي احب اشكر مستر ياسر حنيدق مدير المطعم ومستر محمد الطيب ومستر محمد فارس في البول بار وزياد ومحمد حسانً والشيف احمد الشحات في المطبخ وكل العاملين في كونكورد السلام بحبكم واستمتعت معاكم

title: Concorde  sport
text: Thank you very much to the management of Concorde El Salam Sharm El Sheikh especially the Food and Bevarage Department, restaurants, nice visits, thank you, Mr.Mohamed El-Tayeb, that you, Mr.Yasser Henedieq, thank you, the Pool Bar team, Mr. Mohamed Fares, Ziad and Mohamed

title: Read the fine print
text: Rooms were modern & clean.  Staff was friendly.  The walls are a bit thin as you can hear conversations in the next rooms and in the hallway.  The hotel is not far from the subway and walking distance to midtown attractions.  Read the fine print...when you book through a third party (trip advisor/expedia) all those nice amenities they say are complimentary are actually not.  They charge to your card that you must provide at check in.   Not that 25$ a day is a ton of money, but they failed to tell us that at check in.  Shame on me for not reading the fine print.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
What a gem. Huge rooms, clean and spacious in every way. Bathrooms are huge as well. Comfortable beds. Elevators operate efficiently and fast. Very quiet and noise-free. 
Location is very good. Staff is excellent. From the front office to the security to the restaurant. to the housekeeping staff.  Just marvelous. I can't think of one complaint and I stayed there for 7 days!

title: Servizio pessimo
text: I'm in this hotel for 3 days hollyday. 2Nd day, at 3.30 pm the room has not been prepared and I cannot rest. I think it is not a normal thing for a hotel of this category. I'm very disappointed! The service is very scarce.

title: Great location, clean & modern
text: We were really happy with the Concorde. We were in town for an event on Central Pk South and this hotel was the perfect base. We opted for a king room on a high floor. Very quiet with nice typical NYC views. The bed was super comfortable and the room was modern with a huge bathroom and tub. Highly reccomend.

title: El mejor hotel en Manhattan
text:
Muy limpio, ordenado, todos son muy amables y está bien ubicado, súper bien ubicado.
Y la vista es encantadora!!! 
Cerca de restaurantes deliciosos.
Lo recomiendo absolutamente. 
Me encanta el Hotel. 
Siempre que vengo a Manhattan, me quedo aquí.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in Midtown East
text: I have stayed at the Concorde twice and both times were excellent experience.  The hotel is in a great location, minutes from Central Park, Fifth Avenue, Bloomingdales and many sites and restaurants. The rooms are spacious, especially for New York Standards.  The rooms and bathrooms are well appointed and appear to be relatively new or recently renovated. The staff are very friendly and the lobby is chic and has plenty of areas for quick meetings. I would highly recommend staying at the Concorde for a reasonably priced and centrally located hotel.

title: Excellent!
text:
It’s my second stay at the Concorde Hotel for business purposes and I will definitely come back! Stephania and Shennel were particularly helpful and arranging my stay. But really, the entire staff team is great. I really feel comfortable in the room..which has a bathtub. This is a plus to me. Also the location is the best as I could go to work walking or by a short uber drive. I highly recommend this hotel. 

Sarah

title: Me encanto!
text: Me encanto!!! Fui dos veces en el mes la primera con amigas, rentamos la habitación con dos camas queen amplias nos acomidamos muy bien con 3 maletas grandes y dos carry on, baño grande con tina, buenos productos de shampoo etc, camas cómodas, 15 dias después regrese sola, agarre una habitación de cama queen, maravillosa me tocó está ve muy buena vista estuvo perfecta para mi, tiene su cafetera que te surten diariamente, y calentador de agua para tés, limpieza diaria a una cuadra hay una farmacia CVS, donde puedes comprar aguas y cositas para comer, la habitación tiene frigo bar tmb y a una cuadra también cerca hay un restaurante italiano está rico por si llegas con hambre para comenzar tu recorrido por la ciudad, está a 8 min caminando de la 5ta llegas directo al famoso Bergdorf Goodman y a 13 min de plaza y Central Park

title: Hidden Fees
text:
Hidden resort fees and management was unwilling to do the right thing. 

I stayed for 6 nights and upon check-in, I was told "You are already paid in full, I ONLY need your credit card for incidentals" No resort fee was explained to me at all, and asking for my credit card for normal incidentals would have been the appropriate time, but the staff obviously doesn't want to mention the resort fee because they probably get conflict about it all the time. 

Again, upon check-out, the staff said to me "Yep, you already paid in full, so you're all good! Thank you" The resort fee was still not mentioned. 

A few days after checkout I see a $200 USD charge on my card. I called the hotel and they explained that was the resort fee. For what? They said for use of the gym and for a 24/hour coffee machine on floor 4. There is no pool, there is no room service, no spa, no lounge, nothing. The resort fee is 100% a scam and a money grab. 

During my month in New York, I also stayed at the nearby Kimberley which is a fantastic full-service hotel with actual amenities and they do NOT charge a resort fee. I also stayed at similarly priced/styled Park Terrace at Bryant Park who also did not have resort fees. 

This hotel is not worth the price, especially when the staff do not tell you about the resort fee verbally and try to tell you it was mentioned in some fine-print on a document that no one ever reads. 

Your money is best spent at other nearby properties that don't have sneaky fees under the guise of service charges. 

Also, the elevators were extremely slow, and intermittently out of order. It takes forever to get up or down.

title: Very convenient
text:
The hotel was located at a convenient location and the rooms are surprisingly large for midtown Manhattan. My stay was very comfortable and the staff were amazing and helpful. 
I would come back here for another business trip.

title: Great value, price and location !
text: We love this hotel, the location is in the best place to be in Manhattan. The Hotel had an excelente value and price balance. The rooms had a lot of space to be a NYC hotel, the rooms were very clean and pretty. The hotel staff were also very kind. Super recommended!

title: EXCELLENT value & terrific staff
text:
We were there for a few days with our teenagers and it was a very nice hotel - small rooms, but that's to be expected for NYC.  Great location.  Rooms and bathrooms are updated and it really is an excellent value.  Kudos to the staff - everyone was professional and so nice.  Shanel  both helped me book and make a change to my reservation and she was so patient and knowledgeable.  She helped us choose the exact right room (we needed a rollaway).  Give that girl a raise!  I also called down one morning needing to have laundry done and the very helpful front desk attendant recommended the cleaners 1 block away since it is so much cheaper - THANK YOU!  The only 2 problems are structural - while you can't hear anything in adjoining rooms, the doors must be paper thin b/c you can hear everything that happens in the hall.  And, sometimes the wait for the elevators was several minutes.
BUT, I still highly recommend for the price point.

title: Incredible bang for the buck
text: What an incredible hotel for the price-point (reviewing the deluxe regular room). The room itself was roomy for Manhattan hotel standards and it was clean, beautiful, with a nice view of surrounding midtown buildings. The bathroom is one of the best hotel bathrooms I have experienced: large soaking bathtub, a separate walk-in shower with a rainfall shower head that had incredible water pressure and a separate handheld attachment. Not sure what magic they wield with the bathroom ventilation but even when it should have been steamy it was well ventilated (never heard a vent?). The air-conditioning in the room was fantastic and also super quiet. They don't have a restaurant (they do have a cafe though) but you can get room service via Butler. The front desk staff was friendly and they held our bags after checkout and were really gracious and accommodating in general. If I had to find a con: the first night there was only one bath towel and there were two of us but we inquired with the housekeeping staff the next day and not only were they super lovely to deal with but they supplied us with an appropriate amount of towels.  Other than that, it's a great hotel in midtown, miles ahead of some older properties claiming to be 4 star properties in the same price range.

title: Very good hotel
text: The hotel was really good. The rooms were comfortable, service was excellent and it was located in the perfect area. Special mention to the two wonderful concierge ladies who made my stay very pleasant. All round amazing hotel, and I will surely be back.

title: Great Hotel
text: Clean room, spacious bathroom, complimentary coffee and water in the lobby, friendly staff (greeted me as I was coming and going), safe location. There is also a parking garage right next door and another one a block away, was able to leave my car there without a problem

title: I Love the Concorde Hotel New York
text:
I absolutely LOVE the Concorde Hotel New York! Rada and Estefania at the front desk are wonderful! They have been so kind to me as well as helpful, friendly, professional and accommodating. The service here is fantastic!

The rooms are beautiful and modern, and I love the hotel’s location. The rooms have awesome big screen TVs and mini refrigerators. The bathrooms are lovely, too. The temperature control is perfect, and the heat is fabulously silent. The also have a fantastic coffee machine in their charming lobby. I love it all!

I highly recommend staying here. Thank you so much Concorde Hotel New York!

title: NICE COZY HOTEL
text: Wonderful experience at the Concorde Hotel, very nice and helpful people at front desk. The room was really nice, good space for hanging clothes and a big bathroom. I also love that Central Park was just a few blocks away.

title: Five Stars
text: Great location with convenient shopping, stores, restaurants. Fantastic, professional staff who are super helpful and accommodating. Housekeeping also did an excellent job of disinfecting the room and working around our schedule. I would stay here again.

title: Absolutely love it
text:
Wow. Where should I start? The friendly service. The fancy delicious coffee machine in the lobby that creates everything from lattes to macchiatos to shots of espresso. The gorgeous bathrooms, with a glass-enclosed standing shower on one side, and a soaking tub on the other side. The beautiful large windows with a view of East Midtown. The comfortable bed. The gorgeous decor. The many types of lighting within the room, so that you can create exactly the lighting and mood that you want. The proximity to two major subway stops, plus Whole Foods and various cafes. I swear, I would live in this hotel if I could. 

(And yes, as you'll see in the other reviews, the lobby is under construction at the moment; I didn't mind at all, and this hotel will be even better once it's done, which is astounding, because how can you take "perfect" and make it better?) 

This hotel was one of my favorite parts of being in NYC; I would look forward to going back every night. I cannot recommend this enough. There will forever be a cherished, warm spot in my heart for this hotel.

title: A secret oasis
text:
I’m going to tell you a secret and you have to promise not to tell anyone. 

You can taste New York without New York money.

How? The eminent Concorde hotel. 

I’m here now, writing this review. 

It’s midnight and the Upper East Side looks so beautiful from up here. This window is four times the size of my body and yet I feel so large. It’s all in the room, I think. It makes me feel like I’m Wilson Fisk. I'm Tony Stark. I'm Bruce Wayne upon Gotham. 

In this moment, I run New York.

Wait a moment. Something caught my eye. I wonder why a single room light is on the 61st floor of the Bloomberg building? Is Mike home? 

You really need to see the Bloomberg building at midnight from this floor. What a view.

Back to the Concorde. Every place is defined by its people, so let’s talk folk. All Concorde staff I encountered were excellent, from the courteous doormen to the tireless housekeepers. A few to note: the amiable Christopher Shepard, the efficient Rada Drascovic, the soigné Dukens Alexandre. They exemplify luxury hospitality. Meet them and consider yourself lucky.

Look, we all agree that that hospitality in New York is a gamble, regardless of star ratings or thousands paid. Well, not the Concorde – it’s consistently well reviewed as far as excellence in customer service and I got to experience first-hand why. New York is not known for consistency in anything. I was impressed.

Let’s now talk about the space. Understand that this hotel is less boutique and more New York history. It was born as a residential high-rise owned by a major airline to provide exclusive lodging to visiting crew. Keep in mind that corporations take it very seriously that the people flying their billion-dollar aircraft get the pinnacle of luxury for their night’s rest. So, you will too.

The Concorde is designed with your comfort in mind. That’s why every floor only has four rooms. That’s why the beds are so soft. That’s why the soothing tones of mid-century modern mellow your eyes. That’s why I’m typing this with my laptop on a marble table top. That’s why… the bathrooms. 

Oh, the bathrooms. God damn. We’re talking bathrooms the size of a New York city studio. Professional vanity mirror taking up a warehouse chunk of wall real estate. Walk-in shower and soaking tub. That’s right - and. Have you ever finished a run in Central Park with a perfectly-temperature-controlled Bahamas waterfall of a chilled shower, soak your tired muscles in a home spa of a soothing bubble bath, then back to the Bahamas you go? I have.

A bit about the amenities. Well, there’s the essential WIFI, but note that you can ask for a network cable for better Zooming or Teaming. 92 Mbps down / 94 Mbps up during my stay, by the way. My TV is quite big and has all the usual channels and music. A fridge (mind you, much mini) lets me keep a few refreshments cool for when needed. Finally, an iron and board in the room let me have my pilot uniform looking crisp for my flight out.

A note about laundry - Hill Cleaners (160 E. 55th St) is just down the block. 

If you get bored, there’s a lot to do. Are you a tourist or a non-jaded local? Rockefeller Plaza and Central Park are within walking distance. Funny story – a few days into my stay at the Concorde, I climbed a tree in Central Park to see if I still could. Well, I certainly got down faster than I got up. My rib hurt for a week. Cherish your twenties, kids, because they’ll pass you by.

Be smarter than me and work out at the Concorde gym on the 4th floor. It’s not massive, but has all the essentials: treadmills, bikes, weight machines, and free weights. Mirrors, too – mirrors holding secrets. Shh.

Hungry after all that exercise? Whole Foods and Duane Reade are just 3 blocks away. If you’re so inclined, so is McDonalds. Want takeout? There’s over 30 local restaurants on Seamless. I highly recommend Jackson Hole. The pecan pie is de-li-cious.

Ready for some retail therapy? Bloomies, Saks, Bergdorf, Home Depot, Zara, MUJI, Saks Off Fifth, Uniqlo… to list a few… are within a 10 block radius. I recommend stopping by Columbus Circle on the west side of Central Park too – their Nordstrom is amazing. If you find yourself in the Men’s shop, ask for Will in Men’s Shoes, because he’s a class act and you won’t be disappointed.

Want to travel a bit? Public transportation is readily accessible, both subway trains (N, R, W, E, M, 6) and buses (M2, M3, M4, M50, M101, M102, M103, Q32, Q60). I’m telling you, this place is so convenient.

All in all, staying here is a fantastic experience and I highly recommend it. 

I will forever hold a special place in my heart for the Concorde. It helped me get over a - very - difficult goodbye. This hotel means a lot to me and I hope it will for you, too.

title: Es justo lo que se necesita en la ciudad cuando vas una semana.
text: Atención correcta por parte del personal, habitaciones muy ordenadas y funcionales lugares comunes con servicios extra muy buenos y gratuitos, cafés, chocolate, infusiones ect.  No tuvimos ningún problema con los viajes contados el personal del hotel llamaba y nos preparaba el camino.

title: Didn't make it but hope to soon
text: I was scheduled to stay here in March which unfortunately didn't happen due to COVID-19. I was forced to cancel my arrangements, however I was  so impressed by the courtesy and promptitude with which Concorde staff arranged my cancellation and refund. When all this madness is behind us I will certainly be rebooking with this hotel.

title: Beautiful Modern Rooms in East MidTown
text: The lobby is under construction but the rooms are fresh, modern and very nicely appointed.  The bathrooms are large and very nice.  Only complaint was the wifi was weak in the room - which could be due to the construction disruption.  Great location for sites and restaurants.  Room was very quiet!

title: Great hotel, good location
text: Very modern, good sized room, very clean and comfortable. Good location for exploring the city. A few blocks out of the centre but this only means that you discover more walking in. Plenty of places to eat on the doorstep. My only criticism is that the reception area was under refurbishment when we visited which I am sure will be great for future guests but as a result we were ushered in via a side entrance. The accommodation was lovely, but we missed out on the whole grandeur of staying in an expensive hotel because of the building work. We were not notified of this beforehand and I imagine we still paid full price for the room, despite the reduced facilities.

title: Irréprochable
text: Nous avons séjourné 5nuits au Concorde hôtel. Notre chambre était bien équipée et la propreté irréprochable. L'établissement est idéalement situé sur la 55th et le staff est très professionnel. Nous recommandons sans hésitation

title: Not what I expected
text: Lobby under construction and wasn’t notified prior. Walls very thin, heard everything in the hallway and next door. Stains in the bathtub. Service was average, took 15 minutes to retrieve bags we were storing on check out day. Also very loud early morning construction happening, and ear plugs were not provided.

title: Excellent service
text:
I had booked to stay at Concorde Hotel on a work trip recently.  Unfortunately, due to circumstances out of my control, I had to cancel the trip.  The “policy” I had booked stipulated that there were no refunds on cancellations.  Due to the extenuating circumstances, they waived the cancellation penalty.  I was extremely impressed by their customer service and consideration of the circumstances.  I think this demonstrates a really good business.

I wouldn’t hesitate to book with them again next time I’m in New York.  As an aside, I have previously lived in Manhattan and the hotel is well-located.  That, and their good reviews, were why I chose it.

Thanks, Concorde Hotel for your kindness and consideration.

title: 40th birthday
text: Really enjoyed our stay, despite being out for most of the day the Concorde is a great hotel, good location with super friendly staff. Our suite was huge and well decorated. Thanks for making our trip so memorable 👍

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: We stayed for 3 nights while we explored Manhattan after our wedding. The hotel is a short walk to many subway stations, restaurants, shopping, and Central Park. Our room sported a gorgeous view of the city from the 35th floor. The room itself was clean and every day the housekeepers did a marvelous job tidying up.

title: Good location and nice rooms
text: The staff is friendly the 3 rooms on floor 37 have no carpets. The rooms have a Nespresso machine. The fitness is not great and they have no reataurant. Location is ok. Good value for money in New York.

title: Eccellente!
text: Struttura bellissima, personale cortese e disponibile. Ottima posizione, vicinissimo agli ingressi della Metropolitana...anche a piedi è possibile raggiungere Central Park e Time Square. Consigliatissimo!

title: Not totally finished but a lovely hotel with great staff
text: The entrance is a bit odd as they are still renovating but the staff are lovely and helpful. Our room was spacious and comfortable but i think putting some drinks in the fridge would have been nice! We went with our teenage sons and their room was a floor below us which wasn't ideal but managable so if you book as a family ask for rooms on the same floor, there are only 4 rooms per floor so ask straight away. We would definitely stay there again as very convenient to all the sites in Manhatten, all walking distance. For breakfast we tried a few places, a restaurant and then French patisseries and they were all great value.

title: Stay at The Condorde Hotel NYC
text: I have stayed at this hotel several times now.  It is in an excellent location in midtown Manhattan, easily accessible to the subway, stores, restaurants and tourist attractions.  The rooms are larger than most other hotels in this location and are cleaned to white glove standard. The rooms have excellent views of NYC.  There is a coffee machine and a water boiler in the room with a selection of tea and coffee.  The bed is very comfortable and there is either an easy chair or sofa in the room as well as desk and chair.  The bathrooms are great with a nice shower unit and tub in most of the rooms.  Although the hotel does not have a restaurant at the moment they have recently introduced a room service facility that offers a good selection of food on the menu that is available until 11:00 p.m.  The reception desk is temporarily located on floor 4 and there is also a great seating area there with tea and coffee making facility and a business center.  Out back by the elevator there is a small gym with exercise equipment and some weights also.  I would highly recommend this hotel for the professional, friendly and caring staff who have been helpful each time I have stayed there.

title: Très bien
text: 7 nuits passées dans cet hôtel en février 2020. Tout était très bien : chambre et salle de bains spacieuses (avec une baignoire), literie très confortable, prises USB disponibles, bouilloire et nespresso dans la chambre, penderie avec fer à repasser, radio/réveil, grande télé avec de nombreuses chaînes US . Bonne insonorisation. Tout le personnel est très aimable (à l'enregistrement, mais aussi les portiers et les femmes de chambre). La situation est centrale avec de plus, des stations de métro (vers plusieurs lignes) à proximité. Pour le petit déjeuner (non possible actuellement à l'hôtel mais je crois que cela devrait changer suite au travaux en cours), un Starbuck et un Dunkin Donuts tout à côté (et en allant un tout petit peu plus loin possibilité de vrais déjeuners moins standardisés). Un petite attention le jour de la St Valentin (chocolats). Bref, tout était parfait. Nous avons eu malheureusement un peu de bruit le matin les premirrs jours pour cause de travaux, mais qui ont été terminés en cours de séjour. Nous étions au 8ème étage donc sans vue particulière, mais la vue nous l'avions dehors ! Nous recommandons.

title: Si e No...
Great location, excellent staff!
text: I have to admit that I'm reluctant to give the Concorde such a great review because I'd like to keep this fantastic place a secret. That said, the staff is so great that they deserve to be recognized for their care and congeniality. We've stayed here a few times and will certainly return whenever possible. Everything is within walking distance (depending on your mobility and interests, obviously -- we're big MET, MOMA, and Frick fans).

title: 3rd time staying at the Concorde
text: I always enjoy this hotel, although it went renovation to their lobby they found a great solution and very business oriented hotel. Super clean, super quite, AMAZING new bathrooms. Water, Tea, Coffee complementary.

title: A pleasant surprise
text: The Concorde proved to be a surprisingly nice place to stay.  The room was, by New York standards, spacious and bright, and was very nicely furnished.  The staff was uniformly friendly and helpful.  And the location was perfect for us — handy to the Upper East Side where we had meetings, but an easy walk to many other parts of Manhattan.

title: AGRÉABLE - TRÈS BIEN SITUE
text: Parfaitement bien situé entre Lexington et la 5 ème avenue  - Au calme - très propre - Confortable et personnel toujours disponible et agréable Des travaux actuellement mais l'équipe met tout en oeuvre pour que la clientèle ne soit pas dérangée.

title: ひどいところが多い
text:
日本人です。
ニューヨークの中では、ロケーションや部屋の広さは良い方だと思いますが、残念なところが目立つ。
ハウスクリーニングをしない日があった。
替えのバスタオルを手配して30分以上放置され、催促までしてようやく持ってきたりとか、ルームサービスではナイフやフォークがない、ドアマンはドアを開けずに突っ立ってるだけの時がある…日本の同等レベルのホテルではあり得ないことが普通に起きる。
シャワーの水圧も微妙だし、ウォシュレットもないし、エアコンや水の温度調整もアナログのため最初は少し面倒…。
Wi-Fi は、上り下り10Mbps も出ない。
長期滞在で服や下着を手洗いしても干すところがない。
バスタブがちゃんと掃除できてない。など。
毎日5ドルのチップを置いてるがバカらしく思える。
今ホテルのアップグレード中？らしいが、ついでにスタッフの接客力もアップグレードされたらいいと思った。

title: Eccellente experience!
text: Greta experience at the Concorde Hotel! Strategic location for main actractive, well served by the underground, people at the hotel very kind, room are confortabile and well cleaned. Thks Concorde Hotel!

title: Fabulous hotel brought back great memories
text:
I stayed in this hotel dozens of times when it was owned by British Airways when I was a flight attendant. It used to be called the Fitzpatrick East 55th.
Stayed here again prior to a cruise in November 2019.
Lovely, clean, spacious rooms, especially for NYC. Lovely city views. Excellent location, just off Lexington Ave and walking distance to Fifth Ave, Central Park and many, many shops and restaurants.
Staff were friendly.

title: Perfect for our trip!
text: We had never been to NYC so I was quite unsure about our reservations.. turns out they were great! The hotel is renovating the lobby so you walk in to take an elevator to 4 to check in. They had a nice coffee/espresso machine with tea options. A computer and a big enough lounging area for the space.The room was super roomy and clean and modern and had all the things we needed. I appreciated the lighting options around the room.The cleaning staff was attentive and friendly. The stay was exceptionally quite since there were only 4 rooms on the floor and after a long day in the hustle of the city that was almost priceless. There is so much to see in the city it’s hard to say it’s not convenient. I guess if you are going on a trip specific to a purpose, you would look for a room in a certain neighborhood however, it was close to all public transit, close to Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping. I will definitely stay there again!!!

title: Family trip
text: Great location! Lobby is under construction but they have a very nice business center. They have outside restaurant for rooms service but is very good. Great customer service, big rooms. We will come back.

title: Good location, beautiful room
text: Service, location, and room were good. I chose this hotel because of their eco-friendly practices. The bathroom was nice and large. The coffee and tea were nice amenities. It was quiet. Wifi was fine.

title: I will chose this hotel again. Good value for money.
text:
The staffs are very friendly and helpful. Nearby Is Whole Foods, Duanereade, nice cafe (Little Colines)....
It was a safe area with a high convenience. The wall was a little thin....I could hear the voice of the next door.

title: What a day!!
text: Very nice hotel amongst entry and people at the front desk were quite friendly. I was expecting a nice room, but to my surprise I got a free upgrade to the room with the balcony, talk about a welcome surprise! To bad it was a little snowy, would have been nice to sit out there and enjoy the sounds of the city! Automatic window shades too, and the overhead shower head was a nice touch never used one of those before! Room service was also good and delicious! Would definitely stay here again if the need arises!

title: Very good room. Very friendly staff
text: We stay in New York in Madison/55th area 3 or 4 times a year. For decent quality rooms this is the best value hotel we have found. Modern decor and refurbished in the relatively recent past. Good, quiet air conditioning. Big modern clean bathrooms. This is now our hotel of choice in New York. And the staff all seem happy and helpful.

title: Concorde
text: The Concorde is not your typical chain hotel. It is a little gem in the heart of Manahattan.   Rooms are nicely designed and bigger than most others for the price. Clean, modern, and great views of midtown.

title: Хороший отель, вернёмся в следующую поездку
text:
Понравилось: 
Проживали в данном отеле 2 раза за поездку (на 30 этаже в номере с кроватью Queen-size и на 35 этаже в номере с King-size). Общее впечатление - очень хорошее. Отель не новый, но чистый, с прекрасным расположением. Уютно, персонал внимательный, отзывчивый, готов оказать содействие и помощь.

Не понравилось:
Есть проблема с напором воды в душе и раковине - жили на 35 этаже, попросили увеличить напор - сделать ничего не смогли.
При этом, когда такой же вопрос с напором был на 30 этаже - напор смогли увеличить.
В номере с кроватью Queen-size неудобные подушки.
В номере на 35 этаже дуло из окна и из щелей двери, создавался сквозняк, пришлось спать с кондиционером на обогрев. Вполне возможно, что рама окна не герметично закрывается.
При этом, на 30 этаже было больше окон, проблем не было.

title: Perfect
text:
L’hôtel est bien placé à 200 m de la première bouche de métro ! La chambres sont très propres et le personnel très accueillant ! Rien à redire sur cet hôtel tout est parfait !
Le room service en chambre est parfait

title: January in NYC
text: Concorde Hotel was amazing.  The city view we had up Lexington Avenue was spectacular with a view down E55th to the East river.  Staff were all so helpful and polite.  With such a great location with easy walking distances to the Rockefeller, Times Square and Central Park to name a few.  We would recommend this hotel to everyone.  The transfer time for from JFK was very quick.  Thank you Concorde we will be back.

title: Concorde Hotel, New York
text: Excellent position in Manhattan, close to subway, walking distance to Central Park, Macy’s and 5th Avenue stores. Comfortable rooms and beds, well proportioned bathrooms with strong shower, big windows with excellent views, good coffee and tea making facilities in rooms as well as free tea & coffee in lobby.   Professional, friendly and helpful staff, nothing was too much trouble.

title: Quality Midtown location & value
text: Look no further for good value centrally located modern functional rooms in a friendly hotel. Higher rooms have great views. Really comfortable beds although small. Good security. Free coffee. Bath & shower! Sadly no food but lots of local eateries.

title: Great quality and customer service
text: Excellent quality,  particularly for the NYC! The room is a little small, but very comfortable, and the view is absolutely amazing! I am rather picky, but really enjoyed my stay here. The only issue I had was their Wi-Fi -it was OK for my personal matters, but my company access did not work (we have extra security requirements for public networks). I will be coming back, if I travel not for business.

title: Merita!
text: L’Hotel è in una posizione strategica: comodo per la metro o per raggiungere a piedi le principali attrazioni (Central Park, Rockfeller Center, Cattedrale S. Patrick ecc). Attorno ha diversi locali e catene come Starbuks. Non dispone di una grande hall come altri alberghi ma ha una comoda saletta dove poter prendere e/o gustare una bevanda calda. Ascensore sempre disponibile e veloce. Abbiamo alloggiato presso la junior suite: camera molto ampia dotata di un piccolo frigo, di bollitore e della nespresso. Bagno con doccia molto grande. Il Wi-Fi in camera si disconnette spesso ma negli spazi comuni prende molto bene. Pulizia e servizio impeccabili! Il personale è sempre a disposizione con gentilezza e attenzione. Scelta azzeccata e che rifarei!

title: Great week with family
text: Thanks to the good location of the hotel , we could visit all the chosen places and sites with great facility.. Impressive city with high towers everywhere . New Year is a very good period to visit NY !

title: Un hotel de grand confort
text: Depuis 7 jours nous logeons dans cette hôtel. Nous sommes au 34 ème étages. Hotel très bien situé ,les chambre sont superbes la literie est très confortable à l'accueil les personnes sont très proffessionel.les chambres parfaitement entretenues et le calme incroyable au centre de Manhattan

title: Muy confortable
text: Muy buen hotel. Las habitaciones son luminosas y espaciosas. El baño hermoso. Lindas vistas. Estabamos en el piso 32. El personal super amable. Cafe y te siempre listo. Un patio exterior calido y bien ambientado.

title: GREAT HOTEL AND GREAT LOCATION
text: stay at the Concorde Hotel for 6 nights, and loved every minute of our stay with this hotel, our room was on the 34th floor and what a view, can't thank the staff from this hotel enough so very helpful and pleasant, have seen comments about this hotel about having to pay the taxes after your stay, but do your research like we did and you budget for it, we want to go back to New York at a later date ,and this hotel is where we will be staying again, so once again a big thank you to all the staff who made us so welcome at the Concorde Hotel,

title: First trip to NYC
text: We would definitely recommend staying at this hotel, very close to all attractions and popular restaurants. This was our first trip to NYC and the staff made us feel very welcomed. We were very pleased with the size and comfort of our room, not to mention the beautiful city view. We will definitely stay here again!!

title: Stop looking and book this hotel.
text:
I have stayed at the Concorde Hotel NY from 20th till 26th Dec with the wife.  Room 2703.

All I am saying is that we were very happy with the hotel and had a very comfortable stay.

Very spacious room and bathroom. Loved the shower.

title: hotel tres sympathique
text:
le Concorde Hotel est dispose d'une parfaite localisation
les chambres sont neuves, modernes et tres confortables, l'isolation phonique et thermique parfaites.
les salles de bains sont spacieuses , ( douche italienne et baignoire tres rare a Nyc)
le staff est compétent et charmant.

title: Excellent
text: Very good location,excellent comfortable clean bed,friendly service, free tea and coffe machine at the loby for guests, big  quiet very clean room.we are very pleased.next year we  will go this hotel again

title: Christmas in NYC
text: Hotel bien situado en calle relativamente tranquila para lo que es Manhattan, habitaciones amplias personal muy correcto , al hotel le falta una recepción en condiciones  y por lo menos una cafetería, por lo demás para repetir...

title: Comfortable
text: The room was very spacious and bright. Especially the bathroom was very comfortable. I enjoyed complimentary coffee and water on the first floor. However, I was forced to be kept waiting for elevator to come in the morning.

title: Disappointed
text: I searched for a while on hotels for this year’s visit and the reviews drew me in, along with the bathtub. While the room and view was nice, none of the staff was personable the entire 5 nights I stayed there. My flight was leaving at 4pm and I asked if I could have late checkout at 1pm. The gentleman behind the counter was terse, at best, as he let me know that they were booked up and it would cost me $75 if I checked out that late. Again, I stayed 5 nights there and it was Christmas. I will not be staying there next Christmas.

title: Excellent stay
text: This is no plush hotel,  There is no fancy reception area but WOW the staff are so friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean , spacious and very comfortable with all facilities and downstairs is a free drinks machine with really good coffee and hot chocolate.  Have stayed many times and will return for sure.

title: great place to stay
text: while the concorde no longer flies the ocean, the newly renovated concorde hotel graces manhattan's mid town with spacious, comfortable rooms and a friendly staff.  with coffee in the room and on the first floor, and a deli next door with those incomprable new york bagels, virutally everything you need is well at hand.  within walking distance of the theartre district, times square, and a plethora of restaurants, the concorde is an excellent venue for a new york minute or stay.

title: Perfect
text:
Perfect place to stay in midtown. Everything new and modern.  Junior suite was a treat with windows all around with views. Even electric drapes.
The staff was friendly and helpful. 
Walking distance to everything. 
There is a deli next door and another around the corner.  Lots of great restaurants within a few blocks. 
Would definitely stay here again. It is now my go-to hotel in New York.

title: Very nice hotel in New York
text: Our room was spacious and the king size bed was very comfortable.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I would definitely stay there again.  The location was convenient to shopping and great restaurants.

title: Great Business Location
text: Wonderful staff, large rooms for Mid-Town, great location and proximity to subway.  Good gym (small but well appointed).  Close to a number of excellent restaurants, Madison Avenue shopping.  REluctant to write this as everyone will find out the secret!

title: Excellent
text: The Concorde Hotel was very central to where we were visiting in NYC. The staff on the front desk were extremely helpful and recommended a fantastic steak restaurant just round the corner. Lovely hot chocolate from the coffee machine.

title: Midtown Boutique Hotel
text: Midtown boutique hotel with only four rooms in each floor. Stayed here for a week on a business trip and had a comfortable stay. I liked that there were amenities available like the rain shower and a soaking tub (although I did have to ask to get my drain plug fixed). There is a hairdryer, kettle, and Nestle coffeemaker, along with Molton Brown toiletries. Unfortunately there wasn’t a microwave in the room nor did they have one in the hotel. There is a mini fridge but it’s not that strong. My one complaint is that the WiFi was weak and would intermittently disconnect from my phone and laptop. I ended up getting an Ethernet cord from the front desk so that I would do some work. There was a gym on the fourth floor but I didn’t have a chance to try it - running up and down the stairs was a good workout though! The elevators are pretty slow but it’s nice that the guests all say hello. When you check out there is complimentary luggage storage. There’s also a water dispenser in the lounge along with a bathroom. They had even put umbrellas out for the guests to use when it was raining, which I thought was nice. Overall it was a pleasant stay.

title: Comfortable hotel in central location.
text:
This hotel in Midtown East Manhattan is ideally located for all the trendy shopping areas such as Madison Ave, close to the Theatre district as well with Times square and even within walking distance from Park Avenue and also from Central Park.
The only inconvenience is the lack of Breakfast possibilty, especially in this cold and rainy months. Of course, there are plenty of places for breakfast in the neighborhood, but one has to go outside for breakfast!
The rooms and bathrooms are well kept and the in-room amenities are good. Service was perfect. 
However, the he bathroom lacks some hooks or hangers for the towels!

title: Great Hotel! in a great location
text:
A great hotel in a great location. the room is all new with a luxury feeling and pleasant mood.
Unfortunately it took time the hot water to come and it's inconvenience. the stuff is great and looking to serve you.

title: Lovely little hotel
text: Loved this little hotel.  It has lots of floors but only 4 rooms on each floor. Set in a lovely location you will defiantly get a great nights sleep in the lovey comfy beds.  I would defiantly recommend this small but perfect hotel.

title: Excellent
text:
We have been very good, the room is wonderful, beautiful sights and very clean. The people at the reception are very kind and friendly. The location is excellent.
The only thing I have missed is to be able to have breakfast everyday at the hotel
The rest was wonderful.

title: Amazing!!!!
text:
The first thing we could see was the view. It was amazing! Even though the building is narrow and doesn’t look like much, it’s a hidden gem!  Everything has been remodeled, and the room was exceptionally clean. I am a Mother and was traveling with an infant. I get a little funny about certain things not being clean.... it was immaculate! Our room also had a shower. My husband loved that! The water pressure was amazing! The bed, the sheets, the technology, everything! Most of all though I would have to say the staff. It was actually one of the best overall customer service experiences I have ever had! 
The Concorde Hotel experience all around was the best! 
We also were very pleased with the rates. We live in a resort area in Hawaii so we assumed the rates would be very expensive, but we were very pleasantly surprised!

title: Joli et bien situé
text: Hôtel très bien entretenu et bien situé . Ménage impeccable . Jolie vue .  Pour le personnel certains ne sont pas très aimables mais d’autres en revanche sont top. Notre préférence va à Abou qui est hyper gentil et toujours souriant . Je recommande cet hôtel .

title: Perfect location
text: Excellent location in the vicinity of Madison Avenue, 5th Avenue and the South Central Park. Rockefeller Center and Time Square are 15 min walk. Hotel does not offer breakfast which is not a problem at all, around the corner there are several coffee shops and deli places offering delicious breakfast. I can highly recommend!

title: Enjoyed the service and attitude very much
text: The hotel is in a great location..As amazing and courteous service .. The rooms are clean and cozy..The staff is very professional and nice and gave us a homey feel...in conclusion, we enjoyed it very much and we will certainly come back again

title: Transplanted New Yorkers Best Hotel in MidTown
text: This is the best hotel for business or pleasure traveling. Great location, Incredible rooms, Super conscious staff. While no restaurant on site, there are amazing restaurants right around the block.  This is my go to hotel and I go to New York every month. Stop shopping around --- you found your home. Just don't tell anyone else.

title: Vacanza
text:
Hotel posizionato in posizione eccellente dalla quale si raggiunge tutto molto facilmente, zona abbastanza tranquilla seppur centrale. Camere pulite molto ampie e ben tenute. Personale molto disponibile e molto educato.
Consigliatissimo

title: Great hotel in NYC
text: We have stayed here a few times and loved it each time.  We have stayed in other hotels since we visited my daughter often who lives here. There was always some annoying problem. Not here. Great roomy rooms ..nice courteous staff and great location. And for NYC Standards fairly priced. This will be our go to from now on while visting NYC.

title: Great place; great location
text: Booked this from reviews. Exceeded expectations. Large rooms for midtown. Huge bathroom. Close to restaurants, shows, etc. very good staff. Newly redone. Clean. Rooms had seating, including benches, for 6 or more. Well done.

title: Great location
text: We stayed here for three nights and could not fault this hotel.  The staff were courteous and friendly but at the same time remained professional.  The location is great and it is very easy to get to places from here.  Would I stay at the Concorde Hotel New York? Yes, most certainly!

title: Great hotel, clean, excellent service
text: I stayed in this hotel 4 nights in a king room. The room was big and new, at the 35th floor with a great view. The hotel has been recently renovated. The service level is very high and the service people is always nice and available. The room was very clean. Amenities: nespresso coffee machine, hot water machine. A nice gym at the 4th floor. Everything was perfect. I'm looking forward to come back .

title: Lovely Midtown hotel
text:
We stayed at the Concord for a few nights in late August. Even though they were renovating their atrium, which didn't leave much communal space to relax, it was still a great place to stay. The staff were great, especially the receptionnist who worked the 3-11 shift, she was beyond poite, friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much for her. The review deserves 5/5 simply because of her.
The room was very inviting, absolutely loved the Nespresso machine for a morning coffee without having to pay elsewhere. Bed was super comfy. Bathroom was spotless and very comfortable, good water pressure in the shower. We even found the selection of channels on the TV brilliant. I used the gym a couple of times and it was perfectly adequate for a quick morning workout. 
The location is really good if you want something central and as soon as you walk outside, you are enveloped by the New York that we've all seen on TV and in films all our lives. Loved it!

title: Every member of staff was helpful and friendly.  The room was well appointed and spotless.
text: Staff were super helpful, polite and friendly.  Excellent location for mid town and easy subway connections to the rest of Manhattan.  Rooms are excellent and most are well above the street noise. Just be aware that there is no bar or food onsite.  But there are loads of places very near by.

title: Lovely experience
text: I very much enjoyed my 4 day stay at the Concorde .. the rooms was comfortable, i loved having a radio (in addition to the tv), the bathroom was spacious, and the cleaning/reception staff was very helpful and accommodating.

title: Great NYC Weekend Getaway
text: The Concorde is on E55th, but it is conveniently located next to Park Ave.  A few blocks, 15-20 minute walk and you are near Radio City and Rockefeller Center.  The hotel itself is well appointed and the rooms offer nice views of the city.  I have stayed at other hotels with better views, but this offers nice views.  The lobby of the hotel is small but cozy, the floors have no hallways when you walk off the elevator.  There are only 4 rooms on each floor.  With no hallways and 4 rooms on each floor, rowdy late-night guests (it is NYC) or kids, I can see how no hallway space and close rooms can cause an issue.  The rooms are well-appointed, modern, and the channel selection is superb.  Molton Brown amenities in the room are a very nice touch.  I purchased some when Molton Brown when I got home.  There is free coffee and free Wifi.  What sets this place apart are the employees there!  They aim to please are very knowledgeable.  The hotel appears to always be well booked so plan in advance.  I would highly recommend this hotel and plan to stay here again.

title: Very Poor Internet
text: My room was #2103. After entering the room I found out that there was no internet connection. I called the front desk and after checking what was going on they moved me to antoje ROM. The # 2503. No internet again.

title: Almost perfect
text:
I like almost everything. What I don’t like was that the 3rd floor was dirty and non organized, looks like staff area, in my opinion should be block for guest. Second thing I have coffee and tea machines but both does not work, I mean I need to move everything and approach to a electric connector, I think I should be connect or have a plug to connect next to the machines. The machines work with water and there is no water in the room. I should go to the gym which is open 24 hours to grab some water, not a bottle, plastic glass. Ok that’s my feedback of bad things.
Good things, location : about 5 blocks to Central Park, 2 blocks to 5th ave and like 7 to Times Square, surrounded by restaurants and good stores.
The design of the room is great. I like it very much and was in a cozy style. The prizing is competitive with others hotels.

title: What a find!
text:
I've been looking for a new hotel in NYC that's close to museums, shopping, and work and I've found it!  The Concorde NYC is a lovely, modern hotel on quiet East 55th (between Lex & Park) that's in the perfect location.  The hotel is modern and clean with the most friendly and accommodating staff.  The rooms are the real treat -- I stayed in the Premium King, which I think is the largest of the standard rooms before moving into suites.  It was quite generous and had wonderful appointments, all built-in.  The best being the built-in dresser/luggage rack opposite the king-bed that was a perfect spot for my open suitcase and all the other things that one needs.  The bathroom was huge with plenty of counter space and even a wonderful recessed niche behind the sink under the lighted vanity mirror.  The shower has a great ledge for toiletries, etc. and there is a separate deep bathtub -- none of those ridiculous little tubs that holds no water.  Because of ADA, the bathroom was huge.  
Staff were all warm, welcoming and went out of their way to provide whatever extras were needed and requested.  
I will be back many times for sure!

title: NY Getaway
text: We went on a quick trip to NY. I found the Concorde Hotel on a Google search that had great reviews. The Concorde lived up to their reviews. The staff was great. They were very friendly and helpful. The location was nice. Close to uptown sites but on a street that’s not busy so you don’t have all the noise of uptown. We will stay at the Concorde Hotel again. Thanks for making our trip that much better.

title: good, but...
text:
Rooms are very nice and the staff at the reception desk is very friendly and helpful. 
We stayed for only 2 nights. Isolation in the rooms was bad. Heard every noice from the streets (special from the windows) and in due the bad isolation was in the room cold. We had strongly to heat up the room. Overall nice hotel with a friendly staff.

title: Great Hotel
text: Each of the staff members were helpful and friendly. Special thanks to Estefanía how was very kind and always helpful. The room was Great! Very big and always clean. The hotel is very well located. Sure I’ll be back

title: cuartos pequeños pero confortables
text:
Elevadores tardadisimos. Cuartos pequeños pero completos. Bonitos y amplios baños. Un poco de ruido por la mañana por el housekeeping pero en general buen descanso. 
Me gustó la atención y la amabilidad del personal.

title: Excellent!!!
text: Very recommended hotel to stay in Manhattan, New York. Perfect location, the room is big dan chic. The bathroom is modern with Molton Brown toiletteries. Excellent hotel to stay for business and leisure.

title: Stay In New York
text: I've been staying in New York on and off for over 30 years and this is one of the most ideally located, reasonably priced hotels with friendly accommodating staff. The bedroom was immaculate with both shower and bath, large comfortable bed and spotlessly clean. A hotel which sets the benchmark for my future visits which I will definitely use again for business and pleasure.

title: Etablissement bien situé en plein Manhattan à proximité du métro
text: Excellent hôtel, à taille humaine, seulement 4 chambres par étage. Nous rentrons d'un séjour à NYC et nous y avons passé 6 nuits, j'étais avec mes 2 ados, c'était parfait nous 3; nous avons beaucoup aimé la suite avec sa terrasse privée (la seule de l'hôtel), la chambre confortable, le salon avec les grandes baies vitrées donnant sur l'angle de Lexington avenue, la belle salle de bain avec douche et baignoire. Nous y étions comme à la maison. Et pour le petit-déjeuner, il y a plusieurs cafés juste à deux pas. Tout était parfait, bien sur le personnel concierge, réception, bagagiste est aux petits soins. Oui c'est normal étant donné le prix mais il faut noter que les chambres sont plus grandes que dans la plupart des hôtels de Manhattan.

title: Concorde in New York
text:
My family and friends stayed at The Concorde Hotel so that some of us could take part in the New York marathon and celebrate my 50th birthday.
The hotel was brilliant, the staff very helpful and friendly, the rooms were superb and the location was just right!

title: El hotel ideal
text:
A little jewel in the middle of Manhattan. The staff is super friendly and very welcoming. 
The kind of place you want to return again and again.

Estuvimos del 6 al 13 de septiembre. La reserva la gestionó perfectamente Elianny y un pequeño problema de facturación lo solucionó muy eficiente, el manager mr. Christopher. Gracias

title: Impeccable
text: On y a passé 2 nuits début novembre, aucune fausse note! La localisation est impeccable à 5 minutes du métro, 10 minutes à pied de Rockefeller Plaza, 15 minutes de Central Park... entouré de plusieurs commerces et restaurants. La chambre est spacieuse, propre et bien insonorisée, l’accueil est professionnel et sympathique. Un portier vous ouvre la porte a l’entrée et un groom monte vos valises dans votre chambre (prévoir un pourboire pour lui et pour les femmes de chambre). Il y a une machine à café en libre service dans le lobby. Le lit 2 places est grand, il y a un frigo, une machine à café Nespresso et une bouilloire dans la chambre ainsi qu’un coffre facile d’utilisation. La salle de bains est équipée d’une douche et d’une baignoire. Le prix est totalement justifié, la qualité et la localisation le justifient amplement!

title: Service & Quality of Products
text:
As a 1st time guest of this property I was very pleased from the moment I was greeted at the door,  to the Concierge check-in.
Upon viewing my VERY spacious room, I immediately knew I would be leaving a review.
Courteous staff, more than helpful with any & all questions. 
Very well appointed property. 
Fantastic location. 
I look forward to staying here again when next time in town.

title: Quick break destination
text: Good convenient central location with friendly helpful staff. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and well equipped. Room we stayed in had recently been renovated.  Better public/lounge area would improve things.

title: Great rooms and friendly efficient service
text: Loved the room. Spacious, clean, fancy, and a Manhattan view.  Had to leave my carry on after checking out due to a conference next doors. Good and fast taxi service as well. Going up and down from the 29th floor was seamless unlike other hotels.

title: Un excellent hôtel, nous y reviendrons !
text: Tres bien placé dans Manhattan, l’hôtel Concorde est le point de départ idéal pour visiter New york ! Un accueil professionnel et chaleureux, deux chambres agréables et très propres aux 11ème et 17ème étages, une jolie terrasse extérieure à l’accueil et la possibilité de laisser ses bagages le dernier jour sont quelques points forts de cet hôtel. Nous nous y sommes sentis très bien durant toute notre semaine ! Un grand merci à toute l’équipe pour sa gentillesse !

title: These vagabond shoes, were longing to stay.
text: Booked our stay through Secret Escapes and our only slight disappointment was the resort fee which all NYC hotels appear to be charging these days. The hotel is small and compact and in a great location. We were situated on the 30th floor in a deluxe room which was spotlessly clean, well appointed and a decent size for NY. The bathroom also had a separate bath and shower with excellent bath products and we had views looking onto Lexington Avenue. The hotel doesn’t have a bar or serve food but don’t let that put you off because the chains and independents are in close proximity. All staff encountered were polite, courteous and informative. We certainly wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel and found it to be good value for money.

title: Wow what a find!!!
text: This was my 5th trip to NYC and I wish I'd always stayed here... the rooms were modern and boutique, from the waterfall shower, the huge bed, the pillows my partner wanted to steal, the Nespresso machine, the view from the window seat from the 28th floor... the staff so attentive and wanting to help, the location meant near everything... this is a gem and my only worry is it will get so busy from it's reputation that it's full on my next trip.

title: Pristine Hotel in quiet yet central location
