text: The Concorde Hotel is a brilliant find. It is excellent value for money - the price was really reasonable for such an immaculately clean and comfortable room. The bed was wonderful, with soft premium bedding, and we had a large window which filled the room with light. There is a bath, as well as separate shower which had lovely Molton Brown toiletries restacked each day. There is a nespresso machine, kettle, iron and alarm clock. Despite being so central, on East 55th and Lexington, it was a wonderfully quiet room. The staff were delightful and couldn't do enough for us, and everywhere was pristine and sparkling. There's no bar or restaurant but there are plenty of options just steps away. We loved the hotel and cannot recommend it highly enough.

title: super value hotel
text:
This hotel is relatively new. Only four rooms per floor. In the heart of the manhattan. Super views from the higher floors. Value for money. What else do you want?
Would definetely return. Only minus the fact that it has no restaurant. However, plenty of super places around to have breakfast. And lunch and dinner.

title: Me decepcionó
text: Para empezar la habitacion que me asignaron no era como la de las fotos publicadas. Al reclamar me dijeron que no tenian disponibilidad. Para mi es importante al reservar las fotos que veo, y quiero la misma habitacion que elegi y pague. No tenia gran ventanal ni vistas mas que a oficinas linderas. El wifi no funcionó en toda mi estadia. Tuve que reclamar ya que no me dejaban cafe en la habitacion. No reponian a diario el champu Nunca hubo alguien que hablara español. Para mi fue una desilusion, sobre todo porque me guie por los buenos comentarios que lei del hotel.

title: They overbook and cancel you on the last minute
text:
I've made a reservation for one night at this hotel several months ago, which was confirmed by them.
On the night I arrive at JFK I got an email stating that they were unable to accommodate us, so good luck finding a hotel on a Saturday night in Manhattan.
They didn't provide any further help nor any good reason for leaving us without a place to sleep, what is worse, they let us know on the same day we were supposed to check-in and at the check-in time. 
We had a terrible night thanks to them, so be careful when you book with them, they might cancel you too just when you're about to check-in.

title: if a place to sleep is all you want
text:
Some time in another universe there were too many hotels in NYC and a substantial number were converted into residences. Back to 21 st century: hotel rooms are in short supply and urban planning is out of control so hotels are being established on funny lots . Such is the Concorde which will cost you some $400 a night and will supply a comfortable room in redicuosly small corridors and almost zero publics space.I found this very annoying. 
Granted it is located in the middle of Manhatten so the hotel is surrounded with most of your needs and shops have long hours. Also the staff is friendly and helpful.
At the end of the day "I love the Island of  Manhattan" in the immortal words of West Side Story: annoying but can you really be angry ?

title: Would stay again!
text: This hotel was modern. The room we stayed in was very clean!! The king size bed and pillows were great!!! My husband and I have never understood any hotel that would provide substandard beds or pillows...The Concorde was a pleasant surprise to sleep comfortably every night. The staff was very friendly and always helpful! We would definitely stay here again.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: A little jewel in the middle of Manhattan. The staff is super friendly and very welcoming. The rooms are spotless and the views through the window are breathtaking. The kind of place you want to return again and again.

title: Superb Hotel
text: Visited this hotel for 5 days in September 19, after making the booking in November 18. Lovely hotel in a great location, central for all attractions, We booked a deluxe room, which was spacious, bright and roomy. Clean and airy ( wifi iffy, but not a problem). Staff from check in to check out were always polite and friendly, ever time we left and returned. We were in the city during the UN conference, which impacted on travelling around the city (we saw the DT cavalcade pass by!) As expected a lot of walking whilst in NY, but an easy walk to the E line subway for travelling down town. All in all a great trip to a great city, staying in a great hotel!

title: Che vista
text:
Hotel centrale, ottimo punto di partenza per esplorare la città.
Camere dotate di vista strepitosa (la nostra era al piano 23 wow!)
Manca bar interno o ristorante però ogni stanza è provvista di macchina del caffè e frigo.
Ottima la pulizia. Eccezionale comodità del letto. Fantastici i prodotti Molton Brown in bagno.
Unico neo la doccia che perdeva.

title: Jg
text: Alles was zeer goed in orde.  Goede lokatie. En het personeel heel vriendelijk op eenvoudige vraag werd alles geregeld. Top.   We hebben bij aankomst gevraagd naar kamer met goede WiFi en het werd geregeld

title: Bien situé
text:
Le point fory de cet hotel est son emplacement bien desservi par le subway
Les chabres sont spacieuses et confortables 
Preferez les etages supérieurs si possible pour la vue et eviter le bruit
Personnel tres accueillant et disponible
Pas de restauration possible ni de roof top mais ce n'est pas l'essentiel car on y dort tres bien
Un peu cher mais c/'est new york

title: Bien situe mais...
text:
les points positifs sont evidemment la situation de l'hotel, non loin de la %ieme avenue , de time square et Broadway et central park : il a 4  chambres  par etage  donc peu de traffic dans les couloirs !  Mais,  l'hotel demande un forfait de 25 $ par jour en plus du prix de la chambre et des taxes (cela est generalement le cas dans les resorts avec piscine,  plage etc...) mais dans ce cas, il n y a rien , meme pas de restaurant pour le petit-dejeuner , pas de terrasse (celle en photo n'existe plus) , reste unepetite salle de sport .  J'aurais aime etre prevenue avant d'etre mise devant le fait accompli et j aurai pu comparer avec hotel ayant plus d'equipements.
La chambre est spacieuse mais le lit m'a semble lit par rapport aux standards americains.

title: Hôtel idéalement placé et calme
text:
Nous avons passé un excellent séjour dans cet hôtel idéalement placé , à 20 mn à pied de central Park, à 20 minutes de Times square, au centre de Manhattan . Vous serez logez au calme, la vue au 24 eme etage sur les tours nous a mis tout de suite dans l ambiance de NEW YORK ❤️. L hôtel est complètement rénové, propre et chambre spacieuse, salle de bain avec douche et bain . 
Pour le petit déjeuner, starbucks coffee est à côté , et vous pouvez trouver MR kaiser et paris baguette pour des déjeuner avec pain et viennoiseries à la française . Merci pour cet agréable séjour !

title: Awful
text: So my daughter and I stayed at this hotel for two nights. Its location in the city is the only reason I am giving it one star. The hotel is supposed to be a non smoking hotel. Someone was smoking in their room and because to the very close proximity of the rooms to each other, they might as well have been smoking in our room.  The shower was blocked and caused the bathroom to flood if you took anything longer than a three second shower. We checked in in the early evening so I did not alert the front desk until the next morning as we left to check out the city. They assured me they would address the situation. Well nothing was done to address the situation. Bathroom still flooded and the smoking was just as bad. At over 300 dollars a night, you can put your dollars somewhere else. Disgusting experience.

title: Superbe service
text:
Très bon emplacement. Près de Centrale Park. 15-20 minutes de Time Square.
Très propre.
Très très bon service.
Aux alentours ce n’est pas très propre mais l’hôtel en tant que telle, je n’ai rien a dire contre.

title: Être bien à NY ? C’est ici, à l’hôtel Concorde
text:
Mon fils et moi avons passé une semaine de rêve à NY. L’hôtel est parfaitement situé par rapport à Fifth Avenue, Central Park, Chrysler Building, etc et très bien desservi par le métro qui vous amène partout. Quartier très calme et reposant hors du bouillonnant Times Square. 
Les chambres sont très confortables et parfaitement entretenues. Salle de bain parfaite et produits de toilettes de haute qualité. 
Une machine à café et une bouilloire à disposition dans la chambre ainsi que des capsules de café et des sachets de thé renouvelés chaque jour. 
Des bouteilles d’eau sont à votre disposition en permanence dans le hall d’entrée. 
Le personnel est hyper accueillant et aux petits soins. Je ne peux pas citer leurs prénoms à tous mais je tiens à citer particulièrement Monsieur Abdul qui a été notre interlocuteur privilégié en français. Il a toujours été de bon conseil et particulièrement chaleureux. 
C’est tous ces points positifs qui m’ont fait noter l’hôtel 5 étoiles même si ce serait sympathique qu’un petit déjeuner soit prévu. Il y a tout ce qu’il faut à quelques pas de l’hôtel mais ce serait tellement plus agréable de croquer dans son croissant autour d’une table plutôt que dans son lit. 
On n’a pas toujours envie d’aller s’attabler dès le matin au Starbucks ou autres tavernes où on peut prendre un petit déjeuner avec déjà les odeurs de soupe et autres. 
L’hôtel est non fumeur et c’est très bien. Mais dommage que la petite terrasse à l’arrière était en rénovation (nous comptions sur elle  pour assouvir notre principal défaut 😂) car du coup, obligé d’aller fumer sur le trottoir sans possibilité de s’assoir pour un peu de confort. 
Mais ça, c’est une bonne punition pour nous, nous n’avons qu’à arrêter de fumer !!!
Voilà voilà. Pour résumer n’hésitez surtout pas à réserver cet hôtel vous n’aurez AUCUN regret. Et si vous y croisez Monsieur Abdul, remettez lui notre cordial bonjour.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
I stayed in the hotel with my wife twice in August.
Perfect location to see all the places in Manhattan. Rada as a manager was very happy to help us to take a break in the hotel after check out(shower,drinks,luggage storage). Frontman Patryk was always there to answer any question we had. Real professional!! Nothing more to say. STRONGLY RECOMMENDED for all travelers.

title: Great value for money
text:
Historical hotel in New York totally renewed.
Great position to visit entirely Manhattan and you have also subway and services as amazon go if you need to eat something.
Very clean and all the staff is available if you need something.
You are also very near to the subway line for jfk airport!
Top! Thank you

title: Super location, clean rooms and good service
text:
Super hotel very well located  - the management and ALL staff are very helpful and super service minded and makes you feel welome. Very clean rooms and spacious bathrooms.

One of the best value for money hotel in New York - next visit in November Concorde is going to be my choice.

title: Hotwl senza colazione ma con Nespresso e bollitore in camera
text: Hotel molto comodo, in posizione centrale per visitare Midtown a piedi e comunque molto vicino a fermate di bus e di metro su Lexington Av. Si trova in un palazzo molto alto e stretto, senza sala colazione, ma si supplisce abbastanza bene con la Nespresso e il bollitore in camera, nonche' con le bottiglie d'acqua disponibili in reception (per tutto questo chiedono 25$ al giorno). Arredamento moderno e funzionale, ad eccezione della moquette (avremmo preferito il parquet per problemi di allergia). Comunque pulito

title: great view, lovely staff
text:
Great stay! Walking distance to central park. The staff is very friendly and helpful.
Room was great and very clean. Beautiful view over Manhattan. We stayed for 4  night and did all the NY highlights. Walking or by metro wich is on 5 minuts walking distance of the hotel.

title: Modern hotel, spacious rooms, excellent management
text: This hotel is modern and perfectly located in Midtown, right next to the E train and within walking distance of Central Park, Rockefeller Ctr., etc. Everything is new and stylish, the rooms are really big for Manhattan standards and if you get an upper floor, you’ll have an beautiful view. Management is excellent too. I forgot my passport in the drawer of the desk after checking out and they went out of their way to contact me and let me know. Thanks for everything!

title: Top ervaring
text: Dit hotel heeft mooie, schone kamers. Er is geen eetgelegenheid in het hotel, maar het is gelegen in het midden van Manhattan, waardoor er altijd een grote variatie aan eten op loopafstand is. Het personeel is vriendelijk en behulpzaam.

title: Bien situé !!!
text:
Chambre avec coin salon de belle taille avec mini bar à remplir soi-même. La salle de bain avec douche italienne et baignoire est spacieuse et de bon goût. Le ménage impeccable café à discrétion et bouteilles d’eau fraîches toujours disponibles à la réception ou sur demande.
Meubles et lit vieux et partiellement abimés. Pas de Suite dans les étages supérieurs.
Le plus; un hôtel bien situé par rapport au centre de Manhattan et proche de Central Park.

title: Très bon hôtel à Manhattan
text: Hôtel très sympa et bien placé, à 100m du métro. Chambre confortable avec une belle salle de bain. Terrasse à l'arrière très agréable pour lire ou fumer. Le personnel est très professionnel et il y a une personne qui parle français

title: Great (except for outrageous resort fee)
text:
This hotel was great.  I am giving this hotel 4 stars because:
- the location is great and its super close to Central Park for a morning run and Bryant Park and many walkable destinations
- the rooms are great for business travelers - comfortable, stylish, great placement of power outlets, etc
- no line at check-in
- super small floors of only about 4 rooms each and despite having a baby next door, it was quiet and peaceful for the most part
- the team at the hotel was really nice and I appreciate their friendliness
- i will definitely stay here again and I'll recommend it to others 

*One additional thing. Although I really like this hotel, I left really frustrated. At check-out they explained that in addition to the price I paid for the room (which wasn't cheap and was pretty average for a nice room in NYC), I had to pay a separate charge of $50 for the "resort fee."  This is not a resort.  There are not resort amenities. There is bottled water in the lobby, there is Wifi. These are standard in 99.9% of hotels. This charge amounts to hotels being able to list prices on the internet (and I booked on the hotel's website) that are lower than what you will actually pay.  I'm tired of it and I think it borders on unethical. I asked the front desk to explain the "amenities" that I received in exchange for my $50 and i got a look of agreement with my sentiment.  So.... as much as I'd like to give this and all hotels only 1 star for ripping all of us off with their "resort fee," I don't feel like its fair to ruin their Trip Advisor ratings, when most decent hotels are engaging in this shifty practice.

title: Excellent location, super clean, friendly staff
text:
I stayed in the Concorde for 7 nights in July. I loved the location, really easy to explore on foot or access the nearby Subway.
The hotel was very clean and the staff were all really friendly.
There is no food service/restaurant/cafe in the hotel but the in-room coffee machine was great. There are multiple restaurants on the same street so it's really not an issue.

title: Recommended.
text: Nice hotel in a central location. Large room and spacious bathroom. The beds are perfect. Clean, many additional amenities in the room. Because only 4 rooms per floor, it is very quiet in the hotel. Also relatively little affected by street noise. Friendly staff. The room price is, as many hotels in NYC, pretty high, but any next visit I will definitely book this hotel again.

title: A 5 Star Location and Staff but only an average hotel.
text: My girlfriend and I booked for a week's vacation in NYC based on the great reviews for this hotel.  Overall it was OK, but not exceptional.  This is a spartan minimalist establishment.  There is a reception desk and a small sitting area.  There's a printer and computers on the 4th floor and a work out room.  That's it.  The hotel has bottled water available in the lobby 24/7 --nothing else.  A fruit bowl, or coffee and tea would have been nice, and that's really not too much to ask.  The room was on the small side, but  clean and had a coffee maker, iron, TV and clock radio.  The  maid service was spotty;  did not bring replace enough towels, and failed to clean up used glasses, and washcloths on occasion.  There are no dressers in the room we had; storage was under the bed and limited and closet was small. Our room did not have bathrobes as advertised; we had to request them.  The staff was always extremely responsive and  friendly and helpful.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Stayed in this hotel with my daughter for 5 nights and couldn’t fault it. The rooms were big, bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was brilliant as well. Great shower. Very clean and staff were polite and courteous as well 10/10. Location was central and a short walk to Central Park which is great to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. We were on the 30 floor so a good view. Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend a stay here 👍

title: EXCELENTE RELACIÓN PRECIO CALIDAD
text: Hotel nuevo y bien  ubicado en New York cerca de algunas estaciones de metro, entre Lexington y Park avenue a pasos de la 5 avenida y del central Park, hermosas vistas, habitación cómoda y limpia con cafetera, atención muy buena, zona segura para salir de noche. RECOMIENDO

title: Great mid size boutique hotel
text: We loved our stay here. The room was clean, modern with an excellent bathroom. If you want to stay in Midtown, this is the place. They have no restaurant which is ok as many are nearby. The front desk staff is attentive and helpful. Would stay here again.

title: Happy Stay
text:
This is a great boutique hotel with 4 rooms on each floor, which makes it nice and quiet.
The size of the roomand bathroom is large for NYC standards. 
I truly appreciated the opportunity to do an early check-in in the morning at no extra charge. 
Staff was very friendly. Very good location.

title: Propre et calme
text:
Proche d’une station de la ligne E en provenance de JFK. 
Pratique .
Permet de relier presque tout Manhattan.
Accueil très sympathique 
Hôtel non fumeur mais avec une belle petite terrasse prévue pour et c’est un avantage à New York. Pas de petit déjeuner sur place mais SMITH n’est qu’a deux ou trois blocs comme KAYSER. 
La literie est parfaite et les chambres très propres .elles sont grandes et la salle de bain avec douche et baignoire. 
Les toilettes sont dans la salle de bain .
Machine Nespresso avec gobelets  à emporter .
Il y a 37 étages avec 4 ou 6 chambres par niveau.
Possibilité de laisser les valises le jour du départ et de prendre une douche : c’est super pour profiter à fond de la dernière journée et repartir tout frais !
Franchement excellente adresse . 

La photo c’est la vue de la chambre ... super dégagée .

title: Wonderful NY Find
text:
Second time staying at the Concorde . Rooms are large for New York , incredibly clean and well designed

Location is perfect , out of the craziness but still really convenient . Staff super friendly

Highly recommend !

title: Unbalievable
text: Where do I start. This hotel is amazing. Staff is friendly, front desk always has someone bellman and door man all go above and beyond to make your stay comfortable. And always ask how your day was and eager to advise. Rooms are clean. The view was amazing. We stayed on the 33rd floor and a corner room.  We felt the rooms were a decent size. Bigger than most places we’ve stayed around the world. The bathroom was also decent size. We never had any issues. We always had hot water and never really waited for the lift. And the lift was also very quick. They offer free unlimited bottled water. The room has all amenities you would need a small fridge a decent size cupboard incl some hangers. Even an ironing board. The room is equipped with an espresso coffee machine and pods, a few per day. So no running out.  And a kettle. The bathroom also has toiletries. Towels were always clean and bedding too. I’m really fussy with clean hotels and this hotel is spotless and very new. There is a rooftop which we never really used. Too much to do in New York. The hotel is extremely central. Walking distance to 5th ave and Central Park and has a great view of the Chrysler building when u stand on Lexington Ave.  and actually central to most places in midtown. But given that you walk everywhere in New York. We did over 16kms per day of walking.  We walked to all the sites except downtown. Subway is close and really easy to use otherwise yellow cab and Uber very easily accessible.  We found this little gem for breakfast that was close by called French baguette. On Lexington. I can’t fault this hotel whatsoever. There was nothing that we were dissatisfied with. Highly recommend this place. It was a bit steep on the price but still reasonable. Our currency is really bad so it was our currency that let us down in general in New York and not the price of the hotel. Wood berry commons is a must for shopping. It’s an outlet mall about an hour out of New York. There are busses that leave from Manhattan daily. And we did a doors off helicopter ride with FlyNYON. Highly recommend that too. And if u looking for a fancy dinner Tao uptown and tavern in the green are a must. There is so much to say about this city I just can’t fit it all in. This city is breathtaking. U forget he rest of the world exists. I didn’t really get pics of the actual hotel and room but I have posted pics of our incredible view.

title: nice
text: hotel is super well located, in the middle of everything, I come with my mom to Mathers day and we have an excellent stay, front desk ready for everything , restaurant delicious , all the staff super helpful and the room are clean , I will say that the bellman Jhon is amazing , good job.

title: Amazing Hotel and Amenities
text: The Concorde New York is a real gem! The view from the outside and top is inviting, amazing, and beautiful on a sunny day or snowy one. Upon stepping through the main doors, you are immediately struck by the kind people and beautiful, well lit reception area. Light and airy, and very spacious - very welcoming. The straff throughout the hotel were very professional, friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms are amazing, a wonderful selection of toiletries , and again, the staff was very efficient and helpful in making the check in enjoyable. The location of the hotel is great - right in the middle of most attractions, which are within walking distance. The room that I had was very spacious and well equipped with all essentials. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to visitors. Thank you Concorde for always making my stay so special. I enjoyed this place so much on so many occasions.

title: Great hotel in mid-town Manhattan, close to Central Park
text: We stayed in the Concorde Hotel for 5 nights in May 2019. My wife and I really enjoyed our stay. The entire staff was always friendly, courteous, helpful, and professional. The rooms are first class, very clean (no dust), tastefully and elegantly appointed, and the daily housekeeping was excellent. We appreciated all the extra features - like plenty of outlets for our devices, in-room recycling bin, in-room fridge, hair dryer, step-in waterfall shower, fixed grab bar in the shower, step-free room access, etc. I heartily recommend Concorde Hotel to anyone. We would definitely stay here again, and the prices are reasonable.

title: Great hotel
text:
Great hotel , great location , great service.
1 minute away from subway on Lexington av. & 53th st. and 5 minutes walk away from Lexington av. & 59th st.
The roomes are clean and comfort with a nice town view .
The service of all staff is kind and warm with a huge smile and efforts to assist to any of our requests.

We were staying on hige floors and the water stream was weak.

We loved that hotel and we will be returnig guests .

title: Well located good hotel
text:
This hotel is in a very good midtown location. The rooms are spacious and modern and have great bathrooms. Easy check-in with efficient and friendly staff. Nice bathroom shampoo etc.
I would certainly book there again.

title: Ci siamo trovati bene.
text: Abbiamo trovato questo hotel come miglior soluzione possibile per le nostre esigenze. Centralità e vicinanza alle attrazioni più interessanti (Central Park, 5th Avenue, St. Patrick, Top pf the Rock, Empire State Building... ) Camera pulita e personale competente.

title: Piacevole scoperta
text:
Sono stata a ny un mese fa per lavoro in un rinomato, molto alla  moda Hotel e mi sono trovata malissimo per pulizia, dimensione della camera e servizio (15 minuti per prendere un ascensore...) sono tornata il 25 aprile con mio marito in vacanza e cercavo una sistemazione comoda, con camere e bagno di dimensioni adeguate per due persone... L’ho trovata!!! Posizione ottima vicino a metro, ristoranti di livello e a  pochi passi dalle vie dello shopping!!! Personale gentilmente, camera con vista di dimensione umana, pulita e bagno degno del suo nome (vasca e doccia separate!!!) tutto molto strano per ny!!! La chicca è stata la macchina nespresso in camera oltre al solito bollitore!!! Una vera manna da cielo per noi italiani!!!
Super ma super consigliato!!! 🥰🥰🥰 

Ps la coccola dell’upgrade all’arrivo aggiunge tanti punti 😜

title: Simply the BEST accommodation in NYC **Aussie families take note
text:
The Concorde Hotel New York is exemplary and I would not hesitate to return and also recommend to anyone visiting NYC. Great location easy walk to 5th Ave, several subway stops, quiet area. 
Especially recommended for families needing an additional room. Book the Family Suite - 2 connecting rooms, it will be the largest accommodation you can find! Our suite was immaculate, newly renovated and the wonderful housekeeping team do an amazing job. 
Every member of staff at the Concorde New York takes immense pride in their establishment and we were made to feel most welcome. My children really appreciated the hot chocolate served in the lobby lounge each day. Being from Australia and visiting in the coldest January we have experienced they really looked forward to their nice warm hot chocolate at the end of a busy day in the city. 
Reception is 24/7 and we really appreciated the assistance provided from accepting packages to offering an umbrella on the way out the door to save us returning to our room. 
Location was great, easy access to anywhere so the Concorde is a perfect base if exploring everything on offer in NYC. We found the city very easy to get around and would recommend the Metro Pass. Ubers were also great but can take longer with traffic.

title: I had the best experience ever
text: The girls were wonderful, I visited for my birthday weekend and had the bestttttt experience. From the staff to the quality. everythingggggg.I wish I remembered everyone's names, I would shout them out!!!! But I was with my sister and bff, and they treated us so well.

title: Flight to NY canceled. Hotel not accomodating
text:
I had booked two nights at the hotel but due to weather my flight was canceled. Could not make first night so called hotel and they refused to waive the first night's cancelation fee.

There are a lot of hotel options in the city and not having good customer service can be detrimental. I canceled my entire booking and decided to take my business elsewhere upon my arrival the following day.

title: Outstanding!
text: I need a clean hotel. I need friendly. I need accommodating. This is one of the cleanest,  if not cleanest hotels I've ever stayed at. Beautiful room, small but not for NYC. Very impressed. Staff was wonderful. About a 15 minute walk from Times Square but that's good because I needed to burn calories from the city's food (walk to Patsy's on 60th for amazing Italian) great hotel.

title: Great location and spacious rooms
text:
We stayed in this hotel as we like the area and it had a good price!

Its a cozy hotel with everything you need for a nice weekend in NY city!

Rooms have a really nice size, spacious, nice views and bathrooms are really good size as spotless clean!!

The staff very helpful and nice!

I definitely recommend it!!

title: NIce place
text:
The Concorde Hotel New York is a good choice for midtown NYC. 

My room was not large but very functional. Relatively to NYC, it was fairly quiet as well.

Kind staff, clean rooms, comfortable bed - ticks positively lots of the asks. The location is also excellent.  Pricey but not more than comparable hotels in the city.

title: Incredibly helpful staff, high quality rooms and amazing views.
text: The staff was beyond helpful in accommodating myself and my girlfriend. We stayed 3 nights and when we first checked in we just thought we'd ask if it was possible to move to a higher floor for the city views since we were visiting from out of town. The staff at the desk were beyond friendly in helping us with the request and we had an amazing view the following night. They also accommodated us when we used a pickup laundry app service and food delivery service as well dropping both off to our rooms. If we ever stay in NYC again this place will be our first look to stay. Fantastic service!

title: All I Hoped For And A Bit More
text:
A great experience which I would readily recommend to others. And I'd love to stay again!

Very clean, tremendously helpful staff, (hi Chris!), and in my case a memorable view from a spacious room. Okay not cheap but the "value" issue felt satisfactory. If you don't usually bother with in-house restaurants or bars then this option is well worth considering.

Well-positioned between two subway stations. Private and secluded outdoor courtyard for any die-hard smokers. Second elevator being refurbished but this did not cause me any significant delays.

title: Ottimo!
text:
Hotel molto bello!
Abbiamo alloggiato al 33^ piano, stanza molto grande con vista meravigliosa.
Nel bagno sono disponibili sia la vasca che la doccia.
Posizione Hotel da 10+ 
Ottima anche la pulizia delle stanze.
Staff molto disponibile e simpatico! 
Spero di tornarci!

title: Great Hidden Hotel
text: My husband and I stayed overnight for our anniversary and this hotel was perfect.  It's tucked in so it's easily missed.  The room was surprisingly large with an even bigger than expected bathroom.  The bed was so comfortable and there was plenty of space for the two of us to move around when getting ready.  One of the elevator banks was out of service due to remodeling but never waited very long for the other one to come.  Staff was very attentive and accommodating.

title: Grande chambre, très bien situé
text:
L'hôtel est idéalement situé, en plein centre mais au calme comparé au tumulte de times square, et avec le métro à proximité. Les chambres sont grandes, bien plus que la plupart des autres hôtels au même prix, et refaites récemment. Salle de bain spacieuse et très propre. Pas de restauration sur place (ni petit déjeuner ni restaurant) mais des tas d'emplacement juste en sortant. Nous aurions aimer une chambre un peu plus en hauteur (étage 12 sur 37) pour avoir une vue un peu plus dégagée mais ce sera pour une prochaine fois)
Personnel très gentil.

title: HOTEL SUPER!
text: Siamo stati a New York a Gennaio, il Concorde Hotel è una struttura, pulita e con un personale super! Vicina a Central Park, ma anche a il centro di Manhattan. Abbiamo preso una stanza di 30M ed era tutto perfetto!

title: Excellent Service and Location!!
text: Excellent excellent EXCELLENT hotel!! The staff are absolutely amazing (Patty and Chanel are sooo kind!). I stayed in a suite this past weekend with my sis and friend celebrating a birthday and they made us feel like VIP from the moment we walked in. The suites are beautiful and the atmosphere is amazing. I would recommend them to anyone!!!

title: A Quiet Haven in the City
text: We travel to NY monthly for medical treatment with a teenager who dislikes everything about NYC. Finding The Concorde Hotel has made our trips much more enjoyable. The staff is wonderful and the rooms are spacious, comfortable, immaculate and quiet! Great Midtown East location.

title: Great Boutique Hotel, Great QPR
text:
Location is central to lots of different areas, an easy walk to Grand Central, Rock Center, The Metropolitan Museum and other 5th Avenue Museums, the UN and theater district, as well as just down the block from Bloomingdales.

Excellent dining options within short walk. Concierge recommended Crave Fish Bar for drinks and light bite and the Smith for lunch. Wonderful choices and easy stroll away. 

Front desk folks were very welcoming and helpful. Room was spacious and sleekly modern, as was the bath. Great day, great night, great place, great QPR. Highly recommend.

title: Exceeded expectations
text: I come to NY often for work and are challenged to find an affordable hotel that is in a good location, has quiet rooms, is clean and comfortable. This hotel had all those things and more. The room was stylish, large with a fabulous bathroom and super shower. Nespresso machine in the room, very comfortable bed - all the amenities you would want in a room and very clean. Great working space in the room and have thought of everything

title: Lovely from start to end.
text:
My spouse and I used miles to book this modern hotel in midtown east to celebrate our 30th anniversary of meeting.  Our reception at the front desk was warm and helpful.  We were a bit early and the man at desk secured us a room with a great view right away.  Everyone on staff was friendly and helpful.
The room was extremely clean and bright. The bathroom was spacious, modern, and spotless with a soaking tub and separate shower.
We left the next day and the staff was very helpful allowing us to store our luggage while we walked around the city and visited the MOMA and the Dog Museum near Grand Central.
Would definitely stay here again!

title: Impeccable!
text:
Hôtel très bien situé sur la 55street East.
Propreté irréprochable, chambre de belle taille, moderne et confortable avec une belle vue.
Salle de bain moderne en bon état et bien équipée.
Personnel très sympathique.

title: Great 4 Star hotel in the heart of the city
text:
Lovely hotel in a fantastic location. Definitely deserves it's 4 star rating. 
Staff really friendly, and rooms really clean and well equipped, rooms are big by New York standards too. 
Would definitely recommend and visit again!

title: very pleasant stay
text: The Concorde hotel is small (there is hardly a lobby and no restaurant) but provides travelers with clean, large rooms, huge bathrooms and quiet hallways.  It is in a great location. Staff was extremely helpful and attentive but not intrusive.

title: Photographers Dream!
text: My wife and I flew in to NYC for business. We are street photographers/graphic designers creating content for some clients in NYC for their social media campaigns and we decided to stay at Concorde because of the great location and good reviews. The rooms were awesome! Luxury without the price. Super clean and I made sure to inspect everything down to the bare mattress. Bathrooms were immaculate with rain fall shower head which was amazing after a long day of  photographing the city. We had a desk and couch area to chill and edit work. We didn't have a problem with noise level inside or outside. The staff was super helpful and even called us shortly after check-in to ask if we made it to our rooms alright and if everything was working fine. I'm a coffee addict so the complimentary espresso machine in the room was great in the morning so I didn't have to leave my room to get my first cup of coffee in the morning. We saved money because we didn't have to commute into the city since all we had to do was walk out and we were a few blocks from major landmarks and Times Square. Overall I would recommend staying at Concorde to all of my friends and family when they are traveling to NYC.

title: Great experience
text: First time staying here and we had a great time. The staff was very helpful accommodating requests for our room. Room was very nice and spacious with an amazing view. Will definitely return and encourage others to book here.

title: Friendly service, awful beds
text:
On the outside it looks fancy, on the inside it feels like they are trying to be luxury but it's held up by bandaids. For almost $200 a night I don't think this was worth the price and we should have just spent an extra $100 more to stay somewhere nicer. 

The service was very friendly and accomodating which was nice but there are about 37 floors to this hotel with only one elevator. Be ready to either use the stairs or wait a long time to get out the door. 

It was about 29F the night that the heater in the room decided to not work. Called the front desk and they sent a space heater up and said engineering will have a look at it AFTER we've checked out. We honestly barely got any sleep in the 2 nights that we stayed due to the very uncomfortable bed and loud space heater. I'm not sure how they managed it but the bed sheets were crunchy and felt scratchy. The pillows were so bad that the back of my head hurt! My husband ended up with bad shoulder pains by the end of our stay. I'd also like to complain that they had a duvet comforter but with NO cover on it. I felt very uneasy about sleeping in the bed due to the yellow stains on it.

Lastly, if you are staying here, perhaps bring slippers for the bathroom because the floor is very slippery. They do provide a bathmat to help with it but the shower floor bumper is slippery and I almost broke my neck from slipping. Thankfully I was able to grab onto the glass door and regained my footing. 

The reason why I am giving this place 3 stars at minimum is because of the wonderful staff here. Everyone was friendly, helpful and greeted us with smiles. If you are lucky enough to get an alleyside room it is very quiet.  Overall, skip on this place if you can.

title: Great value in Midtown, NYC
text: The Concorde Hotel NY is conveniently located in Midtown within walking distance of many attractions (St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Plaza, MoMA).  There are plenty of places to eat nearby, and it is convenient to the subway.  The hotel itself is recently renovated in a tasteful contemporary style.  The room was comfortable and spacious.  The staff was friendly, gracious, and professional, and the room rates were most reasonable.  All-in-all a most pleasant 3-night stay.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: "Fantastic Hotel"
text: I stayed at the Concorde Hotel for the first time. The rooms are spacious The staff is gracious and it is a perfect location. I find it to be a home away from home atmosphere and I reccomand it highly” I will definitely be back

title: New go to
text: I stay in NYC every once in awhile and the Concorde is my new go to! This was my second time staying and it was a delightful experience just like the first time. The front desk staff is very pleasant and makes you feel right at home. They also have great suggestions for nearby restaurants. The rooms are modern and spacious and the views I had from the 23rd floor were a nice addition to the stay. The hotel is close to major subway stations making it easy to get to other parts of the city. I will definitely return.

title: Lovely spot
text: My business partner and I stayed in the Concorde for two nights mostly because it was conveniently located to our work and reasonably priced, but it turned out to be a great choice beyond those reasons. We just really liked that it didn't feel like a Marriott or Hyatt etc. Nice rooms, great views of the city, friendly people at reception. And for the free time I did have outside of work, the midtown location was awesome. Definitely recommend.

title: Best hotel ever in NYC
text: Loved the entire vibe of the hotel. Chris and Rafaela at the front desk were all smiles and made us feel very welcomed. Room was exquisite, clean and spacious! What more could one possibly want in such a perfect location? We will definitely be back again.

title: Wonderful NYC Hotel
text:
The location of the Concorde Hotel NY is right in the middle of NYC, close to all the major attractions in Manhattan. There are no major noisy construction near the hotel during our visit.
Concorde Hotel NY is not a very large hotel but yet the room size is very generous. We were staying in a Family Suite. For NYC, Concorde’s room size is outstanding. It’s comfortable, well designed with lots of conveniences in the room. The bathroom has separate shower and bathtub, a bonus in hotel of this price range.
Service of Concorde Hotel NY was impeccable, from the time I directly booked the room with the hotel until I checked out. All the staffs were friendly and their assistance was always helpful and thoughtful. Thank you so much for being so welcoming with such exceptional warm hospitality. We’ll definitely return for another stay in the future.
Thank you once again to everyone in the Concorde Hotel New York.

title: Formidable
text:
Très belle hôtel, les chambres sont spacieuses, et propres. L’accueil est personnalisé et à votre écoute. La localisation est pratique et proche d’une station de metro. 
Je recommande vivement cet hôtel.

title: super honesto
text: O hotel parece ter sido reformado a pouco tempo, o quarto é muito espaçoso, clean e moderno. Atendimento muito bom, excelente custo x beneficio. A localização é otimo, bons restaurantes  metro perto. Vale a estadia.

title: Got some things right
text:
The good... the king suite was large, well appointed and clean.  We had a corner room with many large windows, and a large bathroom.  Check in staff were very nice.

The not so good.... one elevator seemed to be out of service, there was no extra blanket in the closet when it got cold during the night and there were only 2 towels for two people.  (Check these things before going to sleep...) There is no restaurant or concession area to buy refreshments. My colleague on another floor was kept up all night by a raucous party of people too thrilled to be in New York.  Had an odd ‘residency fee’ which they took off after I demonstrated that I had not booked through a discounter.

title: I couldn't have chosen a better hotel for location.
text:
I arrived at the hotel around noon.  I had asked for an earlier check in and they had my room ready for me.  I am sure that is not always possible though.  My room was large and spotless.  The bathroom was very large by most standards and the room and bathroom were both modern.  A huge plus was that I heard no traffic,sirens,hooting etc
from my room.  It was on the 8th floor and looked over a large quadrant where all 4 of the buildings looked over.  I didn't stay there for a view! The staff were exceptional and very friendly,courteous and helpful in every way from the front desk to the door people to housekeeping who were happy to bring fresh towels and anything else you may need. Since I in New York for pleasure I did not want to get up and dresses to get my coffee etc .  Although there are plenty of places around this hotel for breakfast.
I spoke to the from desk asking if any one could get me 2 Starbuck coffee (which was  very close.  There was an additional charge of $10.00 for this service which I was happy to pay for fresh hot coffee and croisants. Although there is no restaurant or bar there is a very cozy sitting area which is quite private and comfortable should any one want to pick you up or visit.
I will always stay here.

title: Excellent, clean, mid-priced hotel with a great location
text: We stayed in two rooms in the middle of December and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel.  The rooms were modern, clean and extremely comfortable.  The room prices were extremely reasonable given the holiday season and we felt we received excellent value for the hotel.  The hotel doesn't have a restaurant, however, that did not detract from our visit given the great location of the hotel.  If you are looking for a high-end luxury hotel with a huge lobby then the Concorde is not the place (but you knew that!), however, if you are looking for a clean, centrally-located hotel at a fair price from which to explore NYC then I highly recommend the Concorde.  The hotel staff are all extremely friendly and helpful.

title: Bem localizado .
text: Próximo do agito mas longe o suficiente pra ter sossego . Boa Vista , pessoal muito educado e tudo arrumado . No lobby sempre fica um chocolate ou chá e um biscoito . Não tem restaurant no hotel mas tem vários no entorno .

title: The Concorde Hotel
text: Came to visit NYC for NYC. Great Choice in hotel. Receptionist are very pleasant and professional. Rooms are completely updated. Great location to areas near Times Square. I would stay at The Concorde Hotel again.

title: Новогодний Нью Йорк
text: Чистенько, но бедненько. Претензий нет. Но предлагая капсулы с кофе, могли бы хоть воду в комнате оставить. Зато это был один из доступных по цене отелей 4 звёзды. И ванная огромная. Почти такая же, как комната.

title: My fiance and myself go down every year for the holiday season. This hotel by far exceeded our expectation and I/we woul
text: The hotel was very friendly a man at the door opening every time we entered or left. They would also open elevator as we were walking towards it. Recommended a place for food P.J.'s Clarkes reasonably priced very good food. Room was rather large with shower and separate bathtub very comfortable beds. We highly recommend.

title: Perfect stay
text: Great location . Beautiful large room -newly renovated with an amazing view (corner room on 36th floor-picture attached). In-room espresso machine. Very friendly servicr. Good fitness room. Would highly recommend.

title: The Bare Necessities For A Great Stay At Mid-Range Price
text: Great location near many restaurants and stores, but you may want to walk to the main roads to the right or left as the road where the hotel sits can get quite congested. The staff are super friendly. The ammenities are not too lavish but luxurious nonetheless. Comfortable bed, tv with several channels, city view surrounded by tall office buildings, a desk to work from, a closet with an ironing board and iron to take out any wrinkles. It doesn't have a fully stocked mini frig, but that means you can use it to store any leftovers or drinks of your own (including water) and you aren't being overcharged for them to provide those services. All in all, a great stay.

title: NYC favorite
text: What a fantastic find! From the spacious well appointed and clean rooms to the friendly and attentive staff! I look forward to returning here again. Location A+ Close to all. Keep up the good work Concorde!

title: Exceeded My Expectations
text: After 3 sleepless nights in a midtown south hotel, I looked forward to my move to Concorde. Before reaching the front entrance the bell staff anticipated my arrival, opened the door and greeted me. Annabelle at the front desk was gracious and welcoming as were all staff. Rada had previously shown me a room which I booked that day for this date. The bright boutiquey recently remodeled lobby and seating area were inviting yet intimate and included an outdoor patio. The elevators quickly whisked me up to my high floor corner room which was thoroughly updated in a clean, crisp minimalist style, comprised of wrap around double paned windows (one of which opens slightly), rain shower and a separate tub. Lighting, both natural and artificial are exceptional. The room was quiet, equipped with a refrigerator and a Nespresso. Molton Brown bath products are provided in my favorite fragrace, orange and bergamot. Rooms provide plenty of bathroom counter space, a safe and city with some east river views. A few rooms have large patios. My friend had an equally nice room as well. The neighborhood is quiet yet close to the essentials, Blow Bar, Gregorys Coffee, Bloomies, Saks, King Cole Room, etc. An architecturally beautiful synagogue is across the street. We walked to see Come From Away and Network on Broadway. Concorde in the past was a British Airways hotel for crew. I am truly sorry that on my past two visits in so many months I did not stay at Concorde but I will be back soon. Prepay for exceptional rates, call direct.

title: Great Location!
text:
I booked this hotel because of it's location. I am always a little weary when booking a hotel that I am unfamiliar with, but in this case it worked out perfectly. 

Rooms: 
The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable! The beds are really comfortable, nice pillows and soft sheets. I am really picky about my pillow so I usually bring my own, but here, I didn't have to. The bathrooms are big, clean and newer. There is a soaking tub and a stand up shower. I loved that the rooms had tall windows to offer plenty of natural light. 

Staff: 
The staff was very warm and friendly. Very helpful!

Parking:
There is a parking lot next door to the hotel on E55th St. That lot wasnt coming up on maps, so we parked a block or so down, not far, but would have been more convenient to have known about this lot. $50/day to park

Location: 
Location was perfect for us. Walking distance to all the popular landmarks such as Rockefeller Center, Times Square, The Met, Central Park and plenty of shopping! The hotel room has a nespresso in room, but the hotel does not have a cafe. There was a Starbucks right at the corder of E55th and Lexington so it was convenient. Great places to eat nearby. For a quick slice of pizza, definitely recommend My Pie on Lexington st between 56th and 57th 

This is the only hotel i have stayed where the hotel photos actually look like the room! Usually i have to check traveller photos, but even the management photos look like the room!

Overall a great experience.

title: Excellent accommodations
text: The hotel was comfortable, the staff incredibly eager to ensure we had what we wanted and needed, and the facility conveniently located to some very good restaurants of all types. Our room was ready when we arrived, it was clean as a whistle with very nice bathroom facilities, and coffee, hot water, and a large screen TV all part of the room. We would be glad to stay at the Concorde again on our next trip to NYC. We can't say enough good things about the quality of the staff. Highly recommended.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Stayed here for a NYC overnighter, convenient location to access the city via Uber or Taxi.

Rooms were modern, clean and pretty spacious, but you get what you pay for as I assume there are smaller rooms here for less money. We had a King size bed which included a bathroom almost the same size as the room!

Staff was friendly and accommodating, can’t ask for anything more than that. There is a parking garage right next to the hotel, they are not affiliated with each other.

Good choice to stay in the city.

title: FILTHY AND DIRTY
text: DO NOT be fooled by the photos. We read good reviews and booked this hotel but, rooms are SO small, barely enough space for a queen bed and a closet. Dirty and filthy bathroom tubs. Complained once, switched us a room with the same dirty conditioned bathroom tub (black dirty mud around the hot water when you’re trying take a bath - refer to my photo proof). Complained secondly, they refused to provide any compensation, just offers a house cleaning when you’re in the room. Their house cleaning is dirty as hell, do not ruin your NY trip here because I did.

title: Luci e ombre
text: Innanzi tutto è più un residence che un hotel, senza un bar, senza ristorante senza colazione, internet instabile nelle camere. Ora le luci, camere spaziose ed eleganti con Nespresso gratuita, bagni superlativi con prodotti di gran marca, pulizia, servizio, staff da 5 stelle, business center attrezzato ,fruibile, elegante, non me la sento di dare meno di 4 stelle, ci torno di sicuro di

title: Limpo
text: Bem localizado, perto de mercado Wholefoods, restaurantes, lugares para café da manhã, 10 min caminhando do Central Park. Quarto e banheiro de bom tamanho, frigobar, silencioso, ar condicionado bom, equipe simpática e atenciosa. Consegui early check in e late check out sem burocracias.

title: Poor facilities in a good location
text: The Wifi is really really poor. It was continually disrupted. As I was on a business trip this was a big problem. As a result I spent a lot of money on phone data to the point my cell phone company disconnected because of unusually high roaming charges. Being fair, the hotel refunded the daily service fee that they charge($26) but that won't cover my data costs and also it meant that work was interrupted repeatedly. The showers were also cold some mornings which wasn't ideal.

title: Great location
text:
We stayed at the Concord hotel recently and am happy to say it was a very pleasant experience, room was very nice and had everything you could ask for, staff very friendly and helpful, the only (small) negatives are the lifts are a little hap hazard (you can be on your way to the ground when suddenly someone on a floor above calls the lift and your off back up) and the bath towels are extremely small (only slightly larger than a hand towel)

Overall though a good experience and I would recommend the Concorde hotel.

title: Fantastic Place to Stay
text: We stayed here in August and its located next to everything we were doing, and the views from our windows were amazing, we had a fabulous stay here. The staff were very helpful. The next time I go to NY I plan on staying here again

title: Excelentes habitaciones
text:
Es una buena propiedad en la zona de Midtown, cercana a muchos atractivos turísticos y restaurantes.

Las habitaciones son muy buenas, modernas y con excelente tamaño para estándares de NY. Los baños bien equipados con regadera y tina separadas. Solo 4 habitaciones por piso y con buenas vistas exteriores.

Actualmente el hotel no tiene más servicios (solo gym), hasta donde entiendo lo siguen remodelando y en un futuro habrá áreas adicionales.

El servicio en general fue bueno, mi única queja es que llegamos a las 3:30pm y no tuvieron listas las habitaciones hasta 2 horas después.

Por último, recomiendo ampliamente la Suite que está compuesta por 2 habitaciones, es un gran deal.

title: Beautiful simplicity
text: Spent a lovely evening in the city and chose this unique hotel conveniently located in midtown close to the Fifth Avenue shopping area.  The room was modern and simply decorated ... very comfortable, spacious room.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Looking forward to coming back soon.

title: Excellent welcome and service, comfortable room
text: This hotel has a great feel - lobby is a bit spartan but the rooms are spacious and comfortable, with a superb bathroom. Well positioned for walking around the City, and close to the Metro. Tip: just round the corner on Lexington there is the Fitzpatrick which has a nice bar for meeting up with people. Also the Pig and Whistle on 3rd Avenue is a good venue to eat and drink.

title: Very good hotel
text: Nice hotel, clean, newly renovated, quiet, comfortable beds and good location! I would for sure stay there again and also recommend it for anyobe travelling to New York. The staff was helpful and we felt safe and at home from the first day.

title: Stayed for four nights.  Perfectly satisfied!
text: The room was perfect with a comfortable bed, deep tub, espresso machine in the room and a fabulous view.  The staff was friendly and welcoming.  I visit NYC regularly and will definitely be staying there again.

title: Great find
text: Fantastic boutique hotel. Great find as newly renovated and good room rates. The hotel does not have a restaurant etc. but this is not a negative as there are so many places to eat and get coffee just a few paces away. Also the hotel provides a mini refrigerator in every room, so you can have a small amount of snacks, drinks in room. The rooms are very clean and modern with a safe and ironing board. The bathroom  and shower is huge and toiletries and a hairdryer are supplied. We stayed three nights. The staff are wonderful and helpful and so much is within walking distance of the hotel. Highly recommend.

title: Overnight visit
text: It was our first time staying here and we will definately stay there again. The room was a good size for the city. It was close to many different attractions and subway stops. The bathroom in the room was great for relaxing in the giant tub or giant shower.

title: Great Midtown Hotel
text: Spacious room (325 sq ft) for NYC. Clean and customer service oriented. Close to everything without being on top of it. 15 min walk to the Rockefeller Center, 20 minutes to Times Square. Nice decor. Big bathroom with walk in shower and a separate tub.

title: Fabulous New York hotel experience!!
text: We just stayed at the Concorde Hotel for 3 nights with our 2 college-aged children. The location of the hotel is great and the staff are friendly and accommodating, but that’s not the best part — best part was the rooms and the price!! We generally look for a suite or book 2 separate rooms. The Concorde Hotel offers a “deluxe family room“ which was 2 rooms connected by a small hallway. The kids stayed in the smaller basic room which was a decent size for New York. Our room was a Junior suite, which was huge! The larger room had couches and chairs which made it so comfortable for the 4 of to just hang out together. Both rooms have huge windows with a great view of 55th St and Lexington Ave.  Each room has its own newly renovated beautiful bathroom. And the price was much less than if we’d booked 2 rooms anywhere else. Overall, a fantastic stay and we will be back! Highly recommend!

title: Visit with girl friend
text: Spent 3 nights. Great location, with a feeling of being a New York resident, rather than a tourist. Nice spacious room with excellent shower and bath. Nice view of the East Side architecture and not closed.

title: excellent rapport/qualite prix
text: Chambre vraiment spacieuse avec vue sur la ville pour un prix tres raisonnable . Tres propre et le personnel est tres cordial . L'hotel a 37 etages et le fait qu'il n'y ait que 2 ascenseurs ne pose pas vraiment de probleme . L'hotel est idealement situe , proche de Time Square , Central Park et des principaux musees . Bref on recommande !

title: Hôtel
text:
Belle chambre, spacieuse, très propre. Avec une vue sur les buildings. 
Une grande salle de bain avec baignoire et douche. De nombreux rangements et un banquette d’appoint. 
Présence d’un réfrigérateur. 
Le hall d’accueil est très basique comparé à la qualité des chambres et des prestations proposées. 
Un point négatif : seulement 2 ascenseurs qui sont parfois assez longs à arriver.

title: HUGE ROOMS, GREAT SERVICE AND HANDS-DOWN THE BEST BANG FOR THE $
text:
First off, let me start by saying the rooms are some of the biggest I have seen in NYC for this price point and the refurb style was pretty rockin'. The Service was super on point as the staff made me feel like a VIP for my week long visit. AND I LOVE Nespresso, but did not miss my machine at home for a minute since the coffee machine in the rooms was none other than a fabulous Nespresso machine. The location was perfectly situated in the middle of all of the action, but not to noisy since it is conveniently nestled on 55th between Lexington and Park Avenue.m

I could go on and on about how great The Concorde Hotel is and feel so lucky to have randomly stumbled across this gem since I frequent the city often. I can not say enough about it and sincerely look forward to staying with them on my next NYC visit.

title: Overpriced and basic
text: So we checked into the hotel and we're greeted by a veritable cornucopia of facilities. There was a reception desk, a receptionist and, errrrr, that's it. It's a pity that the hotel was so overpriced because it meant I had no money left to buy the cat. This was the cat I was going to swing in the bedroom but, no matter, it wasn't big enough anyway. Nothing wrong with the room itself (apart from the size) and it did have a magnificent minibar which was doing a sterling job in keeping the air inside it cool. Obviously, since there was nothing else inside it, it only had to concentrate on the air. On returning to the hotel from dinner out, my wife needed some water. We asked at reception whether there was any available and were directed to the drugstore round the corner. When I enquired as to the reason for having a minibar which was empty and pointed out that by stocking it they could make more money, I was reliably informed that they were thinking of adding a restaurant to the hotel. Guessing (correctly as it turned out) that the restaurant would take more than an hour or two to build, we went to the drugstore for the water. This hotel has nothing, absolutely nothing. No bar, no restaurant, no seating area, no warmth, no character - nothing. I wouldn't mind but at the thick end of $400 (no breakfast of course - nowhere to eat it) this is overpriced nonsense.

title: Localização
text: Muito bem localizado, dá para fazer muita coisa andando e fica perto da park avenue. Estação de metrô perto e a algumas quadras do grand central station, restaurantes próximos e algumas quadras da times! Estava com o lobby em reforma mas não atrapalhou em nada a estadia, funcionários bem atenciosos. Detalhe: o quarto é bem escuro

title: Perfekt
text: This is the perfect hotel for Manhattan .Great located, all attractions in walking distance. Very nice rooms , relatively big for NY ! Clean , very nice bathroom, cool gym . Price is more than acceptable! Can strongly recommend it !!!

title: Great Hotel in Mid-Town
text:
The Concorde was a pleasant surprise. I made a last minute trip to the NYC and my usual hotel was booked so I had to find a stand in. After some research, I found the Concorde and took a leap year if faith and it paid off.

Great location on 55th between Park & Lexington. Right near a Starbucks and a Whole Foods. 

The rooms are super clean and spacious. It’s very quiet and the bathroom was spotless with a shower and a tub. The bed was very comfortable.

The new internet speeds very kind of slow. I don’t try to hardwire with a CAT6 cable so that might be a better choice if you have to complete work in your room.

In summation, I’ll be back to stay at the Concorde.

title: Wonderful staff and perfect rooms
text:
This hotel is perfectly situated on East 55th street.  Ten minutes easy walk to Central Park and of course Park Avenue!  It’s location in a quiet street however means that you can sleep very well.  
The rooms are big for New York and extremely comfortable - we had a family suite which was two separate rooms (one a huge corner room) each with their own lovely bathroom with an extra exterior door leading to the lifts. 
The staff are exceptional - professional and friendly. 
The rooms are cleaned perfectly - so nice to come back to after a days sightseeing.  
Excellent gym too.
The only thing missing was a bar or breakfast room but there are lots of places nearby.
Recommend for families, couples, and business travellers.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: The Concorde is a beautiful hotel located in midtown Manhattan. The staff go above and beyond to ensure guests feel welcomed and appreciated. Everyone, from the security guard to the reservations associate, were pleasant and kind. The room was extremely clean and very well designed. I loved the bathroom which featured a soaking tub as well as a separate, stand up shower. I will absolutely boom at a stay at the Concorde again.

title: Good Value
text: Bright, modern, comfortable room with spacious high-end bathroom with separate tub and shower. Friendly service but no restaurant or room service. A slightly grubby elevator. Room had an unattractive "interior" view. Excellent location and probably about half the price of a similar room in other hotels in the area.

title: Great
text: I spent there 3 days and it was a great experience. Location is great, central park and times square are pretty close. The hotel is new and for NYC stadards, the room is pretty big and staff are friendly.

title: Little gem
text: I would highly recommend this hotel, recently refurbished, very modern and clean rooms, we stayed in the room with the terrace, the terrace is huge, great to be able to sit out in the morning with a coffee and watch the crazy streets of NY below. The staff we very friendly and helpful. There’s also an underground which is just a five minute walk away.

title: One of the best hotels in town!!
text: Concorde offers great rooms and the staff is really great. We felt at home here. Nice spacious room with a very comfortable bed. Quit. Best location in central Manhattan. Downside might be there is no bar, no breakfast, no restaurant. But hee, you're in New York with lots of great bars and restaurants down the street. Most of all we praise the staff. Honestly friendly team, very helpful with whatever issue one might have.

title: Perfecto
text:
Me ha encantado este hotel!

Habitación perfecta, grande, nueva, muy luminosa, baño impecable con bañera y ducha, silenciosa, cama muy cómoda pero no muy grande. La cuna para mi hijo muy buena. Todas las habitaciones son con vistas a la calle cosa que me parece fundamental, porque otras veces que he ido a NYC he pagado lo mismo o más que en este hotel y no te garantizan habitación con vistas a la calle, es más, me ha tocado vistas a patio interior o a generadores... Con lo que valen me parece de broma que como mínimo no tengas vista a la calle. En el Concorde eso te lo garantizan, tiene ventanales enormes la habitación. No es que sean vistas impresionantes pero al menos te entra luz y ves la ciudad.

La atención es exquisita, todo lo que necesitábamos nos lo conseguían, súper amables y educados, te llevan las maletas a la habitación ellos mismos, te facilitan absolutamente todo. 

Muy buena ubicación.

Volveré seguro, gracias por todo!!!

title: Tiny hotel with spacious rooms
text: Just off Park avenue is a sliver of a hotel with, for New York, spacious rooms. A few hiccups with wifi and elevators were annoying however the staff made up for it with great enthusiasm. I f you need to be in this part of midtown you may find the biggest rooms in this tiny hotel. Worth a visit

title: Worst customer service i've ever experienced.
text: Booked the room on hotels.com for one night. Upon arrival to the hotel i was told that hotels.com did not charge me and that they needed to charge my card at the front desk. As a result of the front desk workers being uneducated about how that worked i was charged twice for my stay. I was charged by the hotel and by hotels.com. Upon check out i was told that i would be refunded and an email would be sent with the conformation, that never happened. I gave it a few days and contacted the hotel where i was told it was really confusing on what the person did when they checked me out of the hotel. I was told that a manager would call me the following morning, that also did not happen. After not getting a call back or email still i contacted the hotel again to speak to a manager. The manager finally sent me a conformation of my refund for the charge that should have never happened and was extremely rude on the phone. I do not recommend this hotel if you want decent customer service.

title: Nice quiet hotel
text: I flew in on a red eye and, the friendly front desk staff greeted me early in the morning and were able to get me checked into my room!  The room was pretty spacious for Manhattan hotels and very clean and modern looking.  The bathroom was very nice and the shower was the hidden gem of this hotel, it was a large shower space with good water pressure.  It also has a rain shower head and a regular hand shower head.  Highly recommend staying here while in NYC!

title: Spacious, sunny rooms
text: Rooms are really comfortable and pretty spacious. Big, clean, nice bathrooms. We had a whole wall of windows plus an extra window on the corner. Lots of outlets. Not much street noise facing 55th, quiet at night. However they really really need to fix the wifi and second elevator. These have been an issue since the hotel's earliest reviews. Even during our stay they said the elevator will work the next day or the wifi will be back up later. Second elevator and wifi didn't work over four days. There are 37 floors, maybe most only have 4 rooms, but there were times that it took forever for the elevator to come and there's probably chances it's full by the time it gets to your floor. Staff were all really nice, convenient location. First floor has an outdoor sitting area. But really need that wifi and second elevator fixed.

title: Spacious midtown hotel
text: I was on a short business trip and was booked at this hotel that I read had been recently renovated from an airline crew hotel. I was surprised by how spacious my room was, certainly not a typical NY hotel experience. I was also happy with how everything seemed new and clean. There are definitely quirks they are still working on - one of the elevators was out of order when I was staying, which made it a long wait to get up and down. The desk lamp also didn't work. However, they get high marks for customer service. The front desk and concierge folks are all friendly and helpful. I think this offset the fact that there's no food/drinks inside the hotel. Given the good location, I'm inclined to stay here again.

title: Incredibly spacious suite at an excellent price point
text:
We stayed 5 nights in a 5th floor Family suite which comprises of a gigantic suite and a normal room (1 door opens to a small foyer which then leads to each room).  We paid around $400 net non-refundable per night for the Family Suite.  For the space we got, we were extremely happy.  The suite was special in that it has tons of space and windows while the room admittedly is nothing special.  Both rooms have full and spacious bathrooms, comfortable beds, great showers and AC that was too cold for me.  Wifi was running great.  Quiet as well for a good night's sleep.

I will say, their seating area now is optimal.  I much prefer a proper sofa to the current bench with pillows arrangement.  Similarly, a proper height working chair would be helpful for those on a business trip, especially given the location of the hotel. 

Receptionist and doorman/concierge were always so courteous.  I was particularly impressed that Abdul put all our water in their fridge after we checked out but left our stuff with them first while we picked up our rental car.

All in all, it was an enjoyable stay for us and I would not hesitate to recommend a stay here.  Try the suite.

title: Don't bother staying here
text: This hotel was allegedly rennovated 3 weeks ago. Here is what I found. Flies in my room, pubic hairs in the shower on Day 1, the A/C never went above 74 degrees, despite informing them that the temp was set lower, dirty sheets with marker on them. 2 stars. Good location, but not worth it.

title: Super spot and smartly appointed rooms
text:
When I visited the Concorde it was less than one week after its reopening.
The staff has been extremely pleasant and welcoming - the room was recently and fully refurbished, with a beautiful city view, great bath with super shower and great quality of sleep. 
I cannot rate this establishment on a 5-star basis, due to the fact that there is a complete lack with regards to the breakfast. When I arrived on the 4th floor to have my meal, the room was a sort of living room, with two low tables and a coffee machine. There was a tiny selection of pastries and nothing more. For the location and the quality of the rooms, I found this was quite a slip - I would eventually have negotiated a breakfast coupon in a nice cafe nearby rather than having guests getting disappointed. The other people that came had the same feeling. I will come back and definitely see if my next review will reveal the true potential and assigning the fifth star. Some work to be done but I would be confident the management will work its way out.

title: Great
text:
I was greeted with a nice box of Godiva chocolates and lovely note!

Stayed at the Concorde for four days in NYC and enjoyed it very much. Within walking distance several places!

Great room, comfortable, bathroom had a nice bathtub, which is very hard to find in NYC. 

Staff was very nice and very friendly. Had some issues with my credit card upon check-in, but staff let me in to the room anyways! Also got an early check-in which was great after a long trip.

Will be staying here again.

title: Board meeting
text:
Traveled to NYC for board meeting
Location is very convenient and the prices were very reasonable
Friendly staff and new and very clean rooms with all amenities that are usually available
I will stay here again when I visit

title: Comodo
text:
Camera semplice e pulita servizio colazione al 4 piano con qualche brioches muffins  latte e caffe  ...
Lo definirei essenziale ottima scelta a Manhattan.
Forse inizia a vedersi qualche difetto dovuto al passare degli anni

title: Great Hotel in Manhattan
text:
I stayed here last week for a few days on my first trip to Manhattan as an adult.  This hotel used to be a private airline crew hotel until it was recently renovated and reopened to the public.  Overall, I was very impressed and enjoyed this hotel.  It is very expensive (compared to hotels in places I normally stay at) and things like the breakfast are kind of limited (just simple pastries and coffee / tea), but the price was quite reasonable when I compared it to other NYC hotels in the area.  Be prepared for a ridiculous set of taxes to be added to your bill, but that isn't their fault.

They only have 4 rooms per floor, and the hotel occupies 37 floors.  I stayed on the 15th floor.

The room was comfortable, with new furniture.  They greet you with a personalized card and a small box of chocolates.  The bathroom is spacious and has a nice large shower stall.  I found it odd there was no towel bar to hang towels up, but that's minor.  The closet has a nice little safe, which I used several times.  They also give you a mini-fridge in a cabinet to store your own drinks and food, which I did use.

The staff was excellent, very friendly and attentive.  One day I had an issue with the AC in my room, and I ran into the building engineer in the elevator.  He promptly stopped on my floor to check it, and the next day remembered me when we met again in the elevator and he asked if all was OK.

I only have two small complaints: The first is that one elevator was out-of-service, so that meant I had long waits a couple times for the other one.  The second is that the WiFi access points need to be relocated.  I had great signal strength (and decent speed) near the door to my room, but at the desk by the window at the room's far side it was so weak I couldn't use it.  The building absorbs the signal.

Otherwise, I highly recommend this hotel, and would stay here again when I next come to Manhattan.

title: Amazing!
text: I just love the staff. Amazing!!! Vertical friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is really good and the moisturiser provided smells lush. Maybe th lifts situations need to be fixed tho!  I definitely recommend it!

title: Amazing Stay - I wish I can live in it.
text:
We stayed in New York City two days and one night. We checked in on June 6 and checked out on June 7.

Customer Service: Compared to other hotels we stayed at, the customer service is great. Friendly and very helpful folks. When we first entered our room, there was a personal card and a box of chocolate waiting for us.

Room: It has to be one of best rooms we stayed in. It was very modern and simplicity. The view is nice. I was pretty impressed with the bathroom and the coffee maker. 

Cleanliness: This is a critical factor for me when booking hotels. I have nothing to complain about the room.

title: Great rooms
text: I love this hotel, it’s a great place to stay. The rooms are really great, they are fresh, light and modern. I love the quiet air conditioning and which is a bonus. The staff are friendly and helpful.
